43739795|The Black Belt region of Alabama is endowed with immense forest resources. However, land-loss, high poverty, unemployment, and low education levels have persisted among African Americans, the majority population in the region. This paper discusses the approach, the challenges and the lessons learned by the Federation of Southern Cooperatives in their adaptation of a community-based forestry approach with a focus on social, economic and political benefits for private landowners. Education and technical assistance, coalition-building, networking and cooperative development strategies were used to increase land-retention, improve access to public and private services and implement land-based income-earning opportunities. This approach resulted in the engagement of a marginalised people in land-based poverty reduction strategies. However, many of the poorest have not yet realised the direct benefit of the community-based forestry approach because of its low credibility among private and public land managers and agencies, the time it takes to develop collaborative processes and the Federation's limited resources. La rgion de la Black Belt de l'Alabama est dote d'immenses ressources forestires. Cependant, la perte des terres, la pauvret, le chmage et le bas niveau d'ducation persistent chez les afro-amricains, qui sont la population majoritaire dans cette rgion. Cet article offre un dbat sur les approches, les dfis et les leons apprises par la Fdration des coopratives du sud dans l'adaptation d'une approche forestire base sur la communaut se concentrant sur les bnfices politiques, conomiques et sociaux pour les propritaires terriens privs. Il apparat que l'ducation, l'assistance technique, la formation de coalitions, la communication entre les diffrents partis et stratgies pour le dveloppement coopratif semblent accrotre la rtention des terres, amliorer l'accs aux services publics et privs, et semble aussi faire dmarrer des opportunits de cration de revenus lis  la terre. Cette approche a rsult dans la participation d'une population marginalise dans des stratgies de rduction de la pauvret bases sur la terre. Nombre des plus dmunis n'ont toutefois pas encore ralis le bnfice direct de l'approche forestire base sur la communaut, du fait de sa faible crdibilit auprs des agences et des responsables de la gestion de la terre publics et privs, du temps ncessaire pour dvelopper les processus de collaboration, et des ressources limites de la Fdration. La regin de Alabama llamada "el Cinturn Negro" tiene recursos forestales inmensos. Sin embargo, la prdida de terrenos, un alto ndice de pobreza y bajos niveles educativos siguen siendo problemticos entre la poblacin afroamericana, mayoritaria en la regin. Este estudio analiza el modelo de la Federation of Southern Cooperatives (Federacin de Cooperativas del Sur), y los desafos que ha tenido que afrontar y las lecciones que ha tenido que aprender, en su adaptacin del modelo de gestin forestal comunitaria en aras de privilegiar los beneficios sociales, econmicos y polticos para los terratenientes privados. Se emplearon estrategias de educacin, asistencia tcnica, creacin de coaliciones y de redes de contacto y desarrollo cooperativo para potenciar la retencin de tierras, mejorar el acceso a los servicios pblicos y privados, e implementar oportunidades para aumentar ingresos derivados de las tierras. Este modelo ha obtenido como resultado el compromiso de una poblacin marginada en cuanto a las estrategias de reduccin de pobreza basadas en el uso de la tierra. Sin embargo, una gran parte de los ms pobres no se ha dado cuenta todava de los beneficios directos del modelo de gestin forestal comunitaria, por motivo de su escasa credibilidad entre los administradores de tierras privadas y pblicas y las agencias correspondientes, el tiempo necesario para desarrollar procesos de colaboracin, y los recursos limitados de la Federacin.
24310672|This review charts out recent developments in gender research in forestry research, with a focus on tropical and dry forests in developing countries. We reviewed 121 publications extracted from the Web of Knowledge database and publications by the Center for International Forestry Research for the past 10 years. Over the past decade (20002011) gender-focused forestry research has been dominated by studies that evaluate men's and women's participation in community forestry initiatives and the commercialisation of forest products and market access. Community forestry studies were mainly conducted in South Asia and market access studies in Africa. The geographical spread of studies is uneven, with most studies in India and Nepal. We suggest that the observed patterns relate to recent devolution reforms of forest management, which have a longer tradition in South Asia. The patterns also relate to the focus on poverty reduction efforts that gained widespread prominence in the 1990s. Integrating gender into forestry research is constrained by the broad perception that forestry is a male-dominated profession, a lack of clarity among researchers of the concept of gender, and a lack of technical skills, interest and/or awareness of gender. Key knowledge gaps are identified. Cette tude retrace l'volution de l'intgration des sexes dans la recherche forestire, en s'attachant plus particulirement aux forts tropicales et sches des pays en dveloppement. Nous avons procd  l'examen de 121 publications extraites de la base de donnes du Web of Knowledge et des documents publis par le Centre de recherche forestire internationale depuis les 10 dernires annes. De 2000  2011, la recherche forestire traitant du rle des sexes a t domine par des tudes valuant la participation des hommes et des femmes aux initiatives de foresterie communautaire,  la commercialisation des produits forestiers et  l'accs au march. Les tudes sur l'exploitation communautaire des forts ont t principalement ralises en Asie du Sud et celles sur l'accs au march en Afrique. La rpartition gographique des tudes est ingale, la plupart de celles-ci ayant eu lieu en Inde et au Npal. Nous supposons que les phnomnes observs sont lis aux rcentes rformes de dcentralisation de la gestion forestire, dont la tradition est plus ancienne en Asie du Sud. La situation est aussi en rapport avec les mesures de rduction de la pauvret qui ont pris une ampleur considrable dans les annes 1990. La prise en compte du genre en recherche forestire est freine par l'opinion rpandue que la foresterie est surtout une profession masculine, par le fait que les chercheurs n'ont pas une ide claire de la notion de genre et par l'absence de comptences techniques, d'intrt et/ou de sensibilisation sur le sujet. Des lacunes dans les connaissances essentielles sont mises en vidence. Esta resea registra los desarrollos recientes relacionados al estudio de gnero dentro de la investigacin forestal, con nfasis en los bosques tropicales y secos de los pases en vas de desarrollo. Hemos utilizado 121 publicaciones extradas de la base de datos de la Web of Knowledge y publicaciones del Centro para la Investigacin Forestal Internacional de los ltimos 10 aos. En la ltima dcada (2000-2011) la investigacin forestal enfocada en el gnero ha sido dominada por estudios que evalan la participacin de hombres y mujeres en las iniciativas comunitarias forestales, y la comercializacin de los productos forestales y su acceso al mercado. Los estudios comunitarios forestales fueron llevados a cabo mayormente en Asia del Sur mientras que en el frica el enfoque de la investigacin fue el acceso al mercado. La distribucin geogrfica de estos estudios es desequilibrada puesto que la mayora de los mismos fue desarrollada en la India y Nepal. Nuestra investigacin indica que los patrones observados se relacionan a las recientes reformas de devolucin de los derechos de manejo forestal que ha sido tradicional por ms tiempo en Asia del Sur. Los patrones tambin se relacionan al enfoque sobre los esfuerzos para reducir la pobreza que ganaron amplia prominencia en los aos 90. La integracin del gnero a la investigacin forestal est limitada por la percepcin generalizada de que la silvicultura es una profesin dominada por los hombres, la falta de claridad por parte de los investigadores sobre el concepto del gnero, y la carencia de habilidades tcnicas, inters y/o conciencia para trabajar temas de gnero. Se identifican brechas clave en el conocimiento.
43739454|This paper reviews the evolution of forest policies and forestry institutions in Nepal and tracks the accompanying trends of change in the country's forest cover over the last century. Our objective is to provide an essential foundation to the policy reform process that is underway in Nepal and many other Asian countries. The review shows that before 1957 the Nepalese government's focus was on conversion of forestlands to farmlands, and extraction of timber for export. After the nationalisation of the forests in 1957 until 1976, policy-making efforts were oriented towards national control of forests through stringent laws and expansion of the forest bureaucracy. This approach failed as evidenced by widespread deforestation and forest degradation across the country during the 1960s through 1980s. Early efforts of the government and donor agencies to rectify the problem through reforestation and afforestation also largely failed, but these efforts paved the way for subsequent initiation of the participatory approach to forest management in the late 1970s. Since then, community-based forest management evolved continuously under the aegis of supportive forest policies and legislations. The present community forestry program has met with notable successes in some areas. However, the program has been confronted with some contentious issues in recent years including a policy debate over the suitability of forests in the southern lowlands (the terai) for community management and sharing of income obtained from community forests. These and some other issues surrounding the community forestry program are discussed and their implications for designing or improving future forest governance have been identified. Cet article examine l'volution des plans d'action forestiers et des institutions sylviculturelles au Npal et suit les courants de changement dans la couverture forestire du pays pendant ce dernier sicle. Notre objectif est de fournir une fondation essentielle pour le processus de rforme des lignes de conduite appliques actuellement au Npal et dans beaucoup d'autres pays Asiatiques. Le rapport montre que le centre d'intrt du gouvernement npalais avant 1957 tait la conversion des terres de forts en terres agricoles et l'extraction du bois pour l'exportation. Aprs la nationalisation des forts en 1957 et jusqu'en 1976, les efforts de la politique taient orients vers un contrle national des forts par des lois trs strictes et et un aggrandissement de la bureaucratie forestire. Cette approche choua comme le prouvrent le dboisement  grande chelle et la dgradation de la fort  travers le pays pendant la priode allant des annnes 60 aux annes 80. Les efforts effectus trs tt par le gouvernement et les agences donatrices pour rectifier le problme par le boisement et le reboisement chourent aussi largement, mais ces efforts prparrent le chemin pour l'initiation  l'approche participationelle  la gestion des forts qui allait suivre  la fin des annes 70. Depuis, la gestion forestire base dans la communaut a volu de faon continue sous l'gide d'une politique forestire de soutien et de lois favorables. Le programme communautaire de sylviculture actuel a connu des succs notables dans certains domaines. Cependant, le programme a t confront par des questions  controverses ces dernires annes, incluant un dbat de politique sur la capacit des forts dans les terres-basses du sud (les terai)  permettre une gestion communautaire et un partage des revenus obtenus dans ces forts communautaires. Ces questions, ainsi que d'autres portant sur le programme de la sylviculture communautaire sont examines et leurs implications dans la conception ou l'amlioration d'un futur gouvernement de la fort ont t identifis. Este artculo resume la evolucin de las polticas e instituciones forestales en Nepal y sigue las tendencias y la trayectoria del cambio en la cobertura forestal del pas en el ltimo siglo. El objetivo del artculo consiste en explicar el contexto fundamental del proceso de reforma poltica que se est llevando a cabo en Nepal y en muchos otros pases asiticos. Antes de 1957, el objetivo principal del gobierno nepals consista en la conversin de terrenos forestales en terrenos cultivados y en la extraccin de madera para la exportacin. A partir de la nacionalizacin de los bosques en 1957 y hasta el ao 1976, los tomadores de decisiones centraron sus esfuerzos en reforzar el control centralizado de los bosques por medio de la aplicacin de leyes estrictas y de la expansin de la burocracia forestal. Sin embargo, este enfoque no tuvo xito, como indica la progresiva desforestacin generalizada en todo el pas entre los aos 60 y los 80. Tampoco tuvieron xito los primeros intentos del gobierno y de agencias donantes de corregir el problema por medio de polticas de reforestacin y forestacin, pero estos intentos prepararon el terreno para la introduccin de la metodologa participativa de manejo forestal a finales de los aos 70. A partir de entonces, el manejo forestal comunitario ha evolucionado continuamente bajo la tutela de polticas y reglamentos forestales que apoyan este enfoque. El programa actual de silvicultura comunitaria ha logrado progresos notables en ciertas reas. Sin embargo, en los ltimos aos el programa ha tenido que afrontar algunas cuestiones polmicas, incluidos debates sobre el reparto de ingresos obtenidos de bosques de propiedad comunitaria, y sobre si es apropiado el manejo comunitario en los bosques de las tierras bajas del sur de Nepal (el terai). Se analizan estos temas y otros relacionados con el programa de silvicultura comunitaria, y se identifican sus implicaciones para el diseo y la mejora de planes futuros de manejo forestal.
24310664|The value chains of three internationally important dry forest NTFPs, namely gum arabic, gum olibanum (frankincense) and honey from Burkina Faso, Ethiopia and Zambia respectively, were assessed in terms of the roles played by women and the benefits they obtain from their involvement. Women perform a variety of functions at different stages in the value chains, but their roles tend to be poorly visible and inadequately acknowledged, largely because they are either operating in the informal sector, are part-time employees, or carry out their activities at home between family responsibilities. Where women's roles are more prominent, this is primarily due to gender orientated interventions by external agencies. Several constraints to fostering women's empowerment were identified, with some easier to overcome than others. Particularly difficult to address are gender based, social-cultural barriers. Suggestions for enhancing women's benefits include: greater recognition of informal markets, the opportunities and constraints associated with them, and their position relative to export markets; improved support for collective action where this can provide women with greater voice, negotiating power, and help with economies of scale; more targeted training that addresses areas identified by women as useful and important to them; time-saving technologies and support systems such as child care; and creating greater gender awareness amongst stakeholders. Les chanes de valeurs de trois NTFPs de fort sche internationellement importants, la gomme arabique, la gomme olibarum (encens) et le miel, en provenance respective du Burkina Faso, d'Ethiopie et de Zambie, ont t values en termes des rles jous par les femmes et des bnfices qu'elles drivent de leur participation. Une prminence plus grande de leur rle n'est principalement que le rsultat d'une intervention d'agents extrieurs favorables  la prise de plus de pouvoir par les femmes. L'opposition particulirement tenace est les barrires socio-culturelles bases sur le sexe. Des suggestions pour accrotre les bnfices des femmes comprennent une reconnaissance plus grande des marchs informels, la construction d'une initiative collective, une formation cible et efficace, des technologies permettant d'conomiser du temps et des systmes de soutien, ainsi que la cration d'une prise de conscience du rle des sexes chez les parties prenantes. Se evaluaron las cadenas de valor de tres NTFPs (siglas en ingls) de bosque seco con importancia internacional: la goma arbiga, el olbano (franquincienso) y la miel de Burkina Faso, Etiopa y Zambia respectivamente, en trminos del rol que ocupa la mujer y los beneficios que esta obtiene de su participacin. Las barreras socio-culturales basadas en el gnero son particularmente difciles de abordar. 43740333|With only 3.5 percent of its area under forests, Haryana state has become self-sufficient in small wood, fuelwood and industrial timber by instituting large-scale plantations outside forests, especially on farmlands. These plantations sustain about 670 wood-based veneer, plywood and board, manufacturing units, one large paper mill and about 4 300 sawmills. The units are mainly based on agro-forest produce, and Haryana has become the model state for agro-forestry practices. This overwhelming success results from efforts in the last three decades to promote the raising of plantations in non-forest lands by the state, national government and private and industrial concerns. The trees have not only given impetus to the growth of wood-based industries and employment opportunities but also increased the extent of area under forest and tree cover to 6.63 percent (FSI 2003). Ces plantations soutiennent environ 670 units de manufacture de placage  base de bois, de contreplaqu et de planches, une grande usine de papier, et 4300 scieries. Les units sont principalement bases sur les produits de l'agro-foresterie, et l'Haryana est devenu l'tat modle pour les pratiques en agro-foresterie. Ce succs flamboyant rsulte des efforts effectus par l'tat, le gouvernement national et les parties prenantes industrielles et prives, pour obtenir la promotion des plantations au titre de terres non forestires. Les arbres ont non seulement motiv la croissance des industries bases sur le bois et des opportunits d'emploi, mais aussi l'extension jusqu' 6.63% de la surface sous couvert de la fort (FSI 2003) Con solamente un 3,5% de su rea cubierta de bosques, el estado de Haryana ha llegado a ser autosuficiente en madera de tamao reducido, lea y madera industrial, y esto se ha logrado a travs del establecimiento de plantaciones a gran escala fuera del contexto forestal, sobre todo en tierras de cultivo. Estas plantaciones sostienen alrededor de 670 unidades de fabricacin de enchapado basado en madera, contrachapado y tablones, una papelera grande y unos 4 300 aserraderos. 43740180|Non-Wood Forest Products (NWFPs) play a major role in creating livelihoods for forest dwellers (FDs). FDs generally find it difficult to obtain finance to support their livelihoods and have to depend on pre-harvest trading of NWFPs even though it is exploitative and leads to sale without any value addition. Alternately they have to borrow from traders at high interest rates because they do not have access to formal financial institutions. Provisions for creating access to microfinance will enable FDs to undertake NWFPs value additions and save them from exploitation by moneylenders and traders. The path to sustainable economic development of forest dwellers includes innovative approaches to natural resource conservation, management and utilization. This paper studies the economic impact of NWFP value additions such as storage, processing, adoption of appropriate technology, distribution and packaging. In addition, the amount of microfinance required for employing such value addition activities is assessed. Les produits forestiers autres que le bois (NWFPs) jouent un rle majeur dans la cration de moyens d'existence pour les rsidents des forts(FDs). Les FDs connaissent souvent des difficults pour obtenir le financement ncessaire pour amorcer le processus crant des moyens d'existence. Ils doivent donc dpendre du commerce des NWFPs avec les acheteurs avant la rcolte malgr le fait que ceux-ci les exploitent ce qui conduit  des ventes forces sans aucune valeur ajoute. Leur autre alternative est d'emprunter  ces acheteurs avec un gros intrt allant de 3  5% par mois, ce qui conduit  une dette permanente. Ceci est d principalement au fait que les rsidents des forts n'ont pas accs aux systmes financiers tablis comme les banques etc. S'assurer de pouvoir crer un accs au (micro) financement va permettre aux FDs de pouvoir profiter de la valeur ajoute des NWPFs, et aussi les protger de l'exploitation des acheteurs et des usuriers. La voie vers un dveloppement conomique durable pour les rsidents des forts porte en elle des approches innovatives  la conservation des ressources naturelles, et  leur gestion, leur utilisation etc. Voila pourquoi cet article a essay d'tudier l'impact conomique de la valeur ajoute des NWPFs, comme le stockage, le traitement, l'adoption d'une technologie adquate, la distribution et l'emballage. La quantit de microfinance ncessaire pour permettre aux rsidents des forts de s'engager dans ces activits ajoutant de la valeur aux NWPFs afin d'amliorer leurs conditions conomiques et d'accrotre leur niveau de vie, a t galement tudie. Los Productos Forestales no Maderables (PFNM) juegan un papel importante en el sustento de muchos habitantes del bosque, quienes suelen tener dificultad para financiarse. Se ven obligados a depender del comercio pre-cosecha de PFNM con intermediarios, aunque este comercio sea basado en la explotacin y las ventas se hagan por pura necesidad, sin valor aadido para los productores. La nica alternativa consiste en pedir dinero prestado a los intermediarios con tasas de inters muy altas (entre 3 y 5% por mes), lo cual les conduce a un estado de deuda permanente. Este problema existe sobre todo porque los habitantes del bosque no tienen acceso a sistemas financieros formales como bancos. La provisin del acceso a servicios microfinancieros permitir a los habitantes del bosque crear valor aadido para sus PFNM y les proteger de la explotacin por parte de prestamistas y comerciantes. El camino hacia el desarrollo econmico sostenible para los habitantes del bosque incluye tambin el uso de tcnicas innovadoras en cuanto a la conservacin de recursos naturales, al manejo forestal, a la utilizacin de recursos, etc. Por eso, en este artculo se ha intentado estudiar el impacto econmico del valor aadido en los PFNM, como, por ejemplo, el almacenamiento, el procesamiento, el uso de tecnologas apropiadas, la distribucin y el empaquetado. Tambin se consideran los servicios microfinancieros necesarios para que los habitantes del bosque adopten estas actividades de valor aadido con el objeto de mejorar su situacin econmica.
43739807|There are positive and negative feed-back links between forestry and poverty. The role of forests as part of a rural development strategy is much debated in literature. We have explored this role and links for a montane forest village in East China using official historical data and our own field survey of 92 households. The opportunities that forest resources have offered to farmers at different stages of socioeconomic development are identified. The changes in farmers' livelihood strategies caused by using forest products and the associated increase of inequalities are assessed. Forest management has been gradually shifting from a focus on forest production centred on bamboo to a multipurpose orientation in which conservation to promote tourism has become increasingly important. While bamboo still remains the main income equaliser factor, different forest products add to the portfolio of opportunities of upper and lower income farmers as they move along their development ladders. Les liens reliant la foresterie  la pauvret sont  la fois positifs et ngatifs. Le rle des forts comme faisant partie de la stratgie du dveloppement rural est trs souvent dbattu dans la littrature. Nous avons explor ce rle, et ces liens, dans un village de fort montagneuse dans la Chine de l'est, en utilisant des donnes historiques officielles, et notre propre tude sur le terrain, dans 92 foyers. Les opportunits que les ressources forestires ont offert aux fermiers  diffrents stades du dveloppement socio-conomique sont identifies. Les changements dans les stratgies adoptes par les fermiers pour assurer leurs revenus, causs par l'utilisation des produits forestiers, et la croissance des ingalits qui y sont associes, sont values. La gestion forestire s'est petit  petit dplace d'une concentration sur une production forestire centre sur le bambou  une orientation  plusieurs vises, dans laquelle la conservation pour promouvoir le tourisme tient une place d'une importance croissante. Alors que le bambou demeure encore le principal facteur galisateur des revenus, des produits forestiers diffrents s'ajoutent au portefeuille des opportunits offertes aux fermiers, que leurs revenus soient importants ou faibles, alors qu'ils se dplacent sur leurs chelles de dveloppement. Existen interrelaciones positivas y negativas entre la gestin forestal y la pobreza, y a menudo el material publicado ha examinado el papel de los bosques como parte de una estrategia de desarrollo rural. En este estudio se analiza este tema y las conexiones mencionadas en lo que se refiere a un poblado de bosque de montaa en el este de China, con base en los datos oficiales histricos y una encuesta sobre el terreno de 92 hogares, realizada para este estudio. Se identifican las oportunidades que los recursos forestales ofrecen para agricultores en diferentes fases de desarrollo socioeconmico, y se evalan los cambios producidos en las estrategias de ganarse el sustento debidos al uso de productos forestales, y el aumento asociado de la desigualdad. El modelo de gestin forestal ha ido cambiando poco a poco, desde una estrategia forestal basada en la produccin de bamb hacia un modelo de usos diversos en que la conservacin y promocin del turismo son cada vez ms importantes. Aunque el bamb sigue siendo el mayor factor de equiparacin de ingresos, los diferentes productos forestales aumentan el portafolio de oportunidades para los agricultores de mayores o menores ingresos mientras avanzan por su escala de desarrollo.
43740253|This paper places forestry in the larger context of rural development and therefore in the current debates on poverty and inequality. While Africa has high levels of natural and human capital it is the poorest and most unequal region in the world. In order for natural assets to contribute to environmental, economic and empowerment outcomes four principle interlinked changes are needed: 1) Improve the recognition of the fundamental role of natural resources in economic growth of poor countries and poor populations and in the development of democracies and good governance; 2) Better distribute resource rights, both property and procedural, giving the poor greater security, access and control; 3) Develop and implement frameworks, regulations and enforcement to assure that natural resource markets work for the poor; 4) Redefine the role of science and technology, and associated planning and institutions. Ce commentaire place la foresterie dans le contexte plus large du dveloppement rural, et, par consquent, au coeur des dbats actuels sur la pauvret et l'injustice. L'Afrique est la rgion la plus dmunie et tmoin des plus gandes ingalits au monde; tout en ayant un capital lev de ressources humaines et naturelles. Quatre changements principaux et interdpendants sont ncessaires pour permettre aux atouts naturels de contribuer  un progrs environnemental, conomique, et permettant  la puissance Africaine de se dvelopper: 1) dvelopper la prise de conscience du fait que les ressources naturelles jouent un rle fondamental dans la croissance conomique des pays et des populations pauvres, et dans le dveloppement de la dmocratie et des gouvernement quilibrs; 2) meilleure distribution du droit aux ressources, dans le domaine de la proprit et des processus effectus dans ce domaine, donnant aux dmunis une scurit, un accs et un contrle plus important; 3) dvelopper et instaurer des cadres, des rgles et leur mise en force, pour assurer que les marchs de ressources naturelles amliorent la situation des plus dmunis; 4) redfinir le rle de la science et de la technologie, et l'organisation et les institutions qui leur sont associes. Apart from Russia, China's top Asia Pacific timber suppliers could at best maintain current supply, with natural forest resources being depleted in less than 20 years. Resource limits also constrain expansion and/or long-term continuation of processed product export to China. 43740312|This paper suggests a new approach that recognises distinct forest types based on altitude and associated factors for the high mountain region of Turkey. It describes the situation in four case-study regions of Turkey, in comparison to observations elsewhere such as the Alps. The Turkish high mountain areas have distinct life zones associated with broad geographic areas and changes in altitude, and the altitudinal distributions of tree species in the Turkish mountains are generally placed in three groups. Four zones differentiated by altitude are described in the case-study regions of the Turkish high mountains. These are: 1) 'Lowland Forest', 2) 'Mountain Forest', 3) 'High Mountain Forest and 4) 'Alpine'. In applying this approach to close-to-nature forest management, in contrast to traditional more formal treatments, it reflects local ecological conditions and distinctive forest character. Awareness of zonation and its reflection in practical management is a key to close-to-nature silviculture. It also brings added benefits of enhanced landscape value, nature conservation, and ecosystem functions which potentially improve the economic impacts of tourism. 24310667|This paper highlights the ways that gender analysis has been ignored in the development of forestry and land policy in Senegal. The development of local governance/ rural councils through history and their increased decision-making power that occurred with the 1996 decentralization/ regionalization did not take into account the ways that women's representation (or lack of) on these councils would affect women's ability to access needed resources. This gender policy analysis paper is guided by two main questions: do the main decentralization reforms, which aim for the principles of equity, accountability, ownership and local participation, promote gender equity and tenure rights in access to land and forest resources? How are the forest and land laws and policies gendered and right-based? I argue that, the lack of adequate gender analysis, consideration of local communities' rights, and of accountability mechanisms in forest and land policy reforms is due to the low participation and representation of women in political institutions such as political parties, in legislature, and in local governments and to the fact that the forest sector is not gender sensitive. These traditionally male dominated national and local government institutions are the main causes of inequity and exclusion of marginalized groups mainly women in land and forest governance both at the policy and practical level. As long as forest and land policies remain ungendered and do not have a rights-based approach, women will always be legally and socially marginalized from decision making and benefits from forest and land resources. Before advocating for gender equity and women's rights and tenure in practice, it is necessary and a pre-requisite to have clearly defined gendered national forest and land laws and policies, effective participation and representation of women in political institutions, and gendered accountability mechanisms to hold political leaders, government and local government officials accountable if they fail in practice to recognize women's ownership rights to land and forest resources. 43739638|This paper presents a comprehensive review of the policy and practice of community-based forest management (CBFM) in the Philippines over the last three decades - one of the longest experiences in Asia. As a form of structural policy reform, CBFM may be viewed as radical and progressive. It replaced the century-old corporate mode of forest utilization where benefits flowed directly to an elite minority and attempts to institutionalize a more "people-oriented," approach of forest management. However, progress on the ground in terms of achieving the CBFM's goals on sustainable and equitable forest management remains elusive. Unstable policy, overly bureaucratic procedures, CBFM viewed as a project and not as an approach to replacing commercial large-scale forestry, and weak institutional support system, deter effective implementation. Drawing from three decades of experience, the paper distilled emerging lessons for sustainable and equitable forest management that may be useful to other countries promoting community forestry. 24309832|Forest policies in Nepal encourage community forest users to commercialise non-timber forest products for income generation. This study sought to understand the ability of forest users to increase their household income benefit through commercial non-timber forest product management by conducting a multiple linear regression analysis. Furthermore it compares the income generation potential of traditional to enterprise-oriented approaches. Results indicate that, in the enterprise-oriented approach, low wealth category households derived income benefits only when they had equitable access to forests and a reliable market. The findings also show that, under the traditional approach, income benefits are the highest for rich households and the least for female-headed poor households. In contrast, the enterprise-oriented approach strengthens the role of disadvantaged poor households. The study concludes that commercialisation of non-timber forest products does not automatically result in equitable income benefits for everyone, whereas, locally- crafted rules and norms do. 43739886|Although trade in non-timber forest products (NTFPs) has been widely promoted as an approach to rural development, recent research has indicated that NTFP commercialisation is often not successful. Analysis of the factors influencing success of NTFP commercialisation has been hindered by the lack of an appropriate analytical approach for comparison of case studies. We tested and further developed a methodology recently developed by CIFOR, by examining 16 NTFP case studies in two workshops held in Mexico and Bolivia involving a variety of stakeholders involved in NTFP commercialisation. Workshop participants identified a wide range of measures by which the success of NTFP commercialisation can be defined, which included improvements in social justice, community organisation and local culture, as well as economic status. Participants then considered the factors influencing the processes involved in NTFP commercialisation: production, collection, processing, storage, transport, marketing and sale. Generally product marketing and sale were found to be those processes most constraining overall success. These results illustrate how participatory methods can be of value in analysing the success of NTFP commercialisation, and how a process-based approach can provide an analytical framework for comparison of NTFP case studies. 43739700|This paper highlights the importance of careful selection of tree species for use in buffer zone agroforestry, as a conservation strategy for threatened forest resources. A case study from the Budongo Forest buffer zone in Uganda is used to elaborate the process, where local communities applied a pair-wise ranking system to establish priority tree species and technologies for agroforestry. Maesopsis eminii, Vernonia amygdalina and Lasiodiscus mildbraedii were the top three species selected for integration into the buffer zone farms. Their selection reflects the many good attributes experienced by farmers in the area, such as provision of timber, construction poles, and firewood. The most popular technologies were woodlots, boundary planting and shade trees (multistrata tree planting), in that order of priority. 43740948|The results of the two political meetings during 2001, in Bonn and Marrakech, eventually came to some decisions regarding the role of forestry and land use in the CDM of the Kyoto Protocol. The key decision being that afforestation and reforestation are to be the only eligible activities. The reasons for the exclusion of other land use activities, in particular avoided deforestation projects, and the restriction in use of eligible activities, are numerous. The forestry and land use sector may well have technical uncertainties associated with it, but this is not unique to the sector and often a lack of understanding has resulted in it being separated as a 'special case'. Perhaps the result we have is simply meant as a compromise to please both pro- and anti-sinks supporters, and in which case we must consider whether the CDM will really generate the sustainable development and biodiversity benefits that it is supposed to. Despite the restrictions on the use of forestry, projects continue being developed on the ground and investor interest in forestry credits keeps growing. It remains to be seen how the forthcoming guidance will shape the actual implementation of future activities. In the meantime it is essential that projects continue in order to feed into the policy debate and also that decisions are arrived at based on knowledge and experience of real situations.

43739760|Decentralization in natural resource management (NRM) is increasingly promoted as it is believed to offer better management. This study explores the positive and negative aspects of the forestry conflict that sometimes increases with decentralization. Drawing upon the results of a case study from Sumatra, this study examines how forestry conflict under decentralization processes was viewed by stakeholders. The conflict involved a logging company and a local community, and centered on a disputed forest boundary. The community accused the company of logging within the boundaries of its communal forest. In contrast, the company argued that it was logging within a state forest and was legally protected because it held a legitimate permit issued by the government. It is obvious that the conflict revolved around property rights claims.While forestry conflict is often viewed as a purely negative phenomenon this study shows that forestry conflict has both negative and positive sides. Stakeholders had both negative and positive perceptions of the issue. Conflict was seen to accelerate deforestation, sour relationships and generate high social risk. On the other hand, stakeholders suggested that conflict also created opportunities to participate in forest management, allow negotiation and stimulate learning. To address conflict under decentralization, property rights claims (de facto vs. de jure) need to be addressed and reconciled through negotiation processes so that positive aspects of conflict can be fostered and negative ones can be avoided. Additionally, decentralization needs to be prepared and implemented with care. Strong legal frameworks, clear implementation guidelines and capacity building for stakeholders are important elements that can contribute to the effectiveness of decentralization. La dcentralisation dans la gestion des ressources naturelles (NRM) est promue de faon croissante, tant perue comme  mme d'offrir une meilleure gestion. De plus, la dcentralisation doit tre prpare et mise en pratique avec soin. En cuanto al manejo de recursos naturales, se promueve cada vez ms la descentralizacin, ya que se cree que fomenta una gestin ms eficiente. Este estudio analiza los aspectos positivos y negativos del conflicto forestal que puede ser agravado por el proceso de descentralizacin. El estudio utiliza los resultados de una encuesta realizada en Sumatra para examinar como el conflicto forestal ocasionado por procesos de descentralizacin fue considerado por parte de los grupos interesados. El conflicto estall entre una empresa maderera y una comunidad local, y se centr en una lnea divisoria en litigio. La comunidad acus a la empresa de talar rboles dentro de los lmites de sus bosques comunales, y por otra parte la empresa expres el punto de vista de que la tala se realizaba dentro de un bosque de propiedad estatal, y que gozaba de proteccin legal por disponer de un permiso legtimo emitido por el gobierno. Resulta evidente que el conflicto giraba en torno a derechos a la propiedad, y aunque se suele considerar el conflicto forestal como fenmeno exclusivamente negativo, este estudio demuestra que tiene aspectos positivos y negativos. Los grupos interesados expresaron puntos de vista negativos y positivos sobre el tema, y se comprob que el conflicto acelera el proceso de deforestacin, amarga las relaciones y genera altos riesgos de tipo social. Por otra parte, los grupos interesados sugirieron que el conflicto creaba tambin oportunidades para la participacin en la gestin forestal, permita las negociaciones y fomentaba el proceso de aprendizaje. 43739459|Fossils provide clear evidence of forests covering the Arctic and Antarctic throughout most of the past 250 million years. Ancient polar forests experienced the extreme seasonality of high latitude daylength, but flourished in a warm, temperate climate. For the past 50 years, it has been argued that deciduous trees in these ecosystems conserved carbon by avoiding the respiration required to sustain an evergreen leaf canopy during the continuous darkness of a warm winter. However, only recently have experiments been designed to test this argument by measuring the winter carbon balance of 'living fossil' trees in a simulated warm polar climate. Results of these experiments show clearly that the carbon cost of annually shedding leaves in deciduous trees greatly exceeds the cost of respiration for an evergreen canopy. Simulations with a mathematical model support this finding for mature forests growing across a wide latitudinal range, ending a century-long debate concerning the adaptive role of leaf habit in extinct polar forests. Ce n'est cependant que rcemment que des expriences ont t mises en place pour mesurer l'quilibre du carbone d'hiver d'arbres "fossiles vivants" dans un climat polaire tide simul. Des simulations utilisant un modle mathmatique soutiennent cette dcouverte pour les forts croissant dans une large zone latitudinale, mettant fin  un dbat qui aura dur un sicle sur le rle adaptatif des habitudes des feuilles dans les forts teintes. 24310708|Food insecurity and malnutrition in local populations both result from and drive deforestation. This paper examines the relationships between diet of local people and measures of forest cover and use in the East Usambara Mountains, Tanzania. Data on dietary diversity and intake were collected for 270 children and their mothers. Area of tree cover within the vicinity of each household was examined in relation to forest use and diet. Individuals using foods from forest and other non-farm land had higher dietary diversity, consumed more animal source foods and had more nutrient dense diets. They also had more tree cover in a close proximity to the home, suggesting a relationship between tree cover and forest food use. Households reporting trips to the forest had lower area of tree cover within close proximity, suggesting that land close to the home with tree cover such as agroforest and fallow is important for obtaining subsistence products. Although historically there has been little motivation for local people to participate in forest conservation in the East Usambaras, the maintenance of tree cover in the landscape around the home, especially on agricultural and village land, may be important in ensuring continued access to the health benefits potentially available in wild and forest foods. 43739799|Participatory forest management (PFM) is being promoted throughout Tanzania as a means of achieving conservation and improving livelihoods. PFM was found to provide a new, though small, source of community-level income that was used to improve community physical capital. 43739298|The diversity of criteria and indicators (C&I) sets is often a cause for uncertainty and confusion, and probably one of the reasons for the still unsatisfactory acceptance of C&I as a support for implementation of sustainable forest management. In order to address this erosion of confidence in C&I this paper evaluates the diversity of five C&I sets (CIFOR, ACM, FSC, ITTO and Tarapoto) relevant for the Brazilian Amazon by analysing frequencies of C&I in relation to parameters about content and quality. The study demonstrated that the C&I sets, although addressing the social, technical, ecological and economic dimensions of sustainability, exhibit different thematic foci. A general lack of validity was attested as well as missing specificity and practicability of the indicators. In order to increase objectivity and transparency, the C&I have to reflect more clearly and unambiguously what is actually assessed. It is recommended to include a discussion about verifiers and assessment methods in the development of C&I sets. To avoid misunderstandings and to introduce the possibility for less complex and more practicable C&I sets, the authors recommend constriction of the objective of the assessment to more clearly serve the potential clients and frame-conditions for its application. 43740131|The paper distinguishes between collusive and non-collusive corruption in the forestry sector and analyses their interaction with the political/institutional environment. While non-collusive corruption increases costs for the private sector, collusive corruption reduces costs for the bribee, therefore it is more persistent. Data from confidential interviews in Indonesia show that illegal logging, supported by collusive corruption, became widespread after the fall of President Suharto. While economic liberalisation and competition among government officials may lower non-collusive corruption, they exacerbate collusive corruption. During political transitions, countries are particularly vulnerable to collusive corruption because governments are often weak and fragmented, with underdeveloped institutions. Sustained wider reform and institutional strengthening to speed up the transition to a true democracy is needed to fight collusive corruption. For Indonesia greater accountability of government, legal and judicial reform and encouragement of public oversight could be useful corner stones for combating illegal logging and corruption. 43740308|Policy and legal changes in Uganda have partly devolved forest management from the central to local governments and local community organisations. This paper analyses the roles, responsibilities, powers, legal instruments and incentives for local organisations that are implementing decentralised forest governance in Uganda. Semi-structured questionnaires and key informant interviews of 236 respondents revealed that local organisations promoted decentralised forestry functions such as forest monitoring, making of forest byelaws, tree planting, environmental education, collaborative and integrated planning and budgeting. Donor and central government fiscal support, awareness of forest degradation, understanding the role of forestry and the desire to conserve forests motivated local organisations to participate in decentralised forest management. Lack of a clear policy on ownership and control of private forest resources, inadequate fiscal support from national government, inequitable distribution of benefits and inadequate delegation of decision-making powers over forest management to local actors have hindered full implementation of decentralised forest management. The central government should empower local government authorities and support organisations to effectively implement decentralised forest management in Uganda. 43739511|Development assistance is changing quickly. More than half of all aid to some countries now takes the form of direct contributions to the national budget. There, has been a distinct move away from sectoral programmes and projects and a decline in related funding from the peaks reached during the early 1990s. This decline has been more marked in productive sectors, including rural development, than in social sectors such as health and education. These changes reflect a poverty focused development agenda. This agenda links the Millennium Development Goals with mechanisms and instruments for delivering aid that includes poverty reduction strategy papers (PRSPs) and general budget support. This paper explores what these changes mean for international forestry assistance.

43739720|CITES (the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora) controls international trade in species listed in its three Appendices. While timber species have been listed under its three appendices since its inception in 1975, CITES has not been considered as widely used for controlling timber species in trade as it has been for other wildlife species. Even so, there are a number of provisions within CITES that apply equally to timber species, in terms of management, and throughout its value chain up to the points of export, import and, uniquely to CITES, re-export. However, the capacity of CITES to combat illegal logging in particular, and to manage native timber species for conservation and economic benefit in general, is not used to its full potential. CITES can fulfill this role if all parties work together and do not perceive CITES as merely a trade ban, or a Convention only about restricting timber trade, but more as a useful tool to complement management of this important natural resource. 43739757|A bio-economic model is used recursively to analyze charcoal supply from the charcoal zone to urban consumers in Kampala. The model is a combination of a non-linear matrix forest growth model and an economic model with the objective of maximizing annual profit from charcoal production for the period 2003-2050. Standing stock and charcoal production for each time period are predicted for the base scenario, and alternate scenarios relating to technological advances and regulatory interventions. In the base scenario, harvest levels are above the sustainable yield, with 85% reduction in standing stock by the year 2050. A sudden collapse in charcoal supply occurs in the year 2019. Combining technological advances and regulatory interventions leads to more sustainable charcoal supply as compared to implementation of any single regime. Policy makers are therefore faced with the challenge of such implementations in order to achieve sustainable resource utilization. 42609370|This study compared the diversity and structure of a community-managed 13-14 year old successional broadleaf forest with a semi-protected, mature natural forest in the Middle Mountains of Nepal. Community management applied silvicultural thinnings (treatments: 0, 1 or 2 applications) to enhance the successional process and promote a forest with high enthnobotanical utility. The community forest exhibited a high density of small diameter trees, typical of a young successional forest. Mature, semi-protected forest had substantially greater basal area than the community forest, but there was little difference in total basal area between unthinned and thinned blocks of community forest. Diversity indices among mature forest, unthinned community forest and thinned community forest were very similar. This suggests that although structure is not complex in community forest, diversity was rapidly restored through succession, and that silvicultural thinning did not greatly affect forest diversity. This study provides quantitative biological evidence that under the appropriate circumstances, community forest management can protect and encourage a diverse regeneration in the Middle Mountain region of Nepal. 43740278|Migrants to the Brazilian Amazon frontier arrive individually, but the formation of effective community associations can bind these families together and speed socio-economic development. In this paper we study how formal logging contracts between smallholders and the timber industry affect one aspect of development and organization on the forest frontier: community associations. We ask whether these contracts encourage smallholders to participate in associations and whether the associations with formal logging contracts appear to be more effective. We find that individuals in communities with formal logging contracts are more likely to participate in their respective associations, and are also more likely to rank the association positively, compared to individuals living in other communities. Although the world of social and economic development on forest frontiers is complex and this result far from definitive, it demonstrates the potential for improved logging contracts to be a positive influence on community cohesion. 43740133|The global trade in illegal wildlife and wildlife products is now the second largest form of illicit commerce, surpassed only by the trade in illicit drugs. It is also one of the leading causes of global biodiversity loss. Over 1,500 trees species are considered globally threatened as a result of logging. This paper shows how the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species (CITES), one of the most successful of all international treaties, can be used to control the illegal international trade in timber species. To date only 23 timber species have been listed on the three appendices of CITES. Under the provisions of the Convention, Parties shall not allow trade in specimens except in accordance with the provisions of the Convention, thus controlling the international trade in these species. This includes the illegal timber trade. Mahogany (Swietenia macrophylla) King is one of a limited number of timber species in international trade that is currently regulated under CITES. Since mahogany has been listed on Appendix III of CITES, illegal shipments of mahogany have been seized and stopped. Le commerce illgal mondial de la faune et de la flore et de leurs produits est aujourd'hui le second march de commerce illicite, urpass uniquement dans sa taille par le commerce des drogues llgales. C'est galement l'une des plus importantes causes esponsables de la perte de la biodiversit. On considre que plus de 1500 espces d'arbres sont menaces  l'chelle mondiale par l'exploitation (WCMC 2000). Il en rsulte que le commerce international dans ces espces est contrl, et, par consquent, le commerce illgal galement. 43740176|Social conflicts with local people have caused some unsuccessful timber plantation developments in Indonesia. 42610109|The paper analyses the structure of non-timber forest products (NTFP) markets in the humid forest zone (HFZ) of Cameroon from a spatial perspective. A characterisation of 25 markets based on a set of products, traders, and marketplace attributes was produced. The combination of the attributes size and self-sufficiency results in four main types of markets (national, provincial, local and frontier), whereas clustering based on all the attributes clearly distinguishes the northern and southern areas of the HFZ, and an urban-rural, core-periphery relationship within each area. This separation reflects different product specialisations and diversity, as well as market size. Dacryodes and Gnetum predominate in the northern markets, which tend to be larger, whereas Garcinia lucida, G. kola and Irvingia are relatively more abundant in the southern markets. In general, larger markets are more diversified and their traders are more specialised than the smaller ones. There are also differences in product storage time, distance from source of products, level of taxation, and transportation problems. The need to understand the multiple, non-linear interactions among these factors is stressed. Cet article prsente une analyse spatiale de la structure des marchs de produits forestiers non ligneux (PFNL) dans la zone de fort humide (ZFH) du Cameroun. Les caractres de 25 marchs ont t dfinis  partir de plusieurs types de produits, de commerants et d'attributs des marchs publics. Un regroupement suivant la taille et le degr d'autosuffisance fait apparatre quatre grands types de marchs: national, provincial, local et pionnier. Un regroupement par attributs montre une nette distinction entre les rgions nord et sud de la ZFH et,  l'intrieur de chacune, l'existence de liens ville-campagne et centre-priphrie. Cette diffrenciation s'explique par la taille des marchs, leur spcialisation et la varit de leurs produits. Dacryodes et Gnetum prdominent dans les marchs gnralement plus grands du nord, alors que Garcinia lucida, G. kola, et Irvingia sont relativement plus abondants dans les marchs du sud. On trouve en gnral une plus grande diversit de produits et des marchands plus spcialiss dans les grands marchs. La dure d'entreposage des produits, la distance de leur lieu de provenance, le niveau des taxes et les difficults de transport varient galement. Les auteurs insistent sur l'importance de bien comprendre les interactions multiples et non linaires entre ces facteurs.

43740078|The Government of India introduced Joint Forest Management (JFM) into the National forest policy (1988) as a result of realising the importance of participatory approach to forest management. The policy envisages one of the essentials of forest management as being that the forest communities should be motivated to identify themselves with the development and protection of forests from which they derive benefits. The establishment of JFM agreements has allowed departmental field staff to redefine their relationship with villagers to regain their trust and alliance. To achieve this, a study was conducted that focused on a comprehensive inquiry within 14 Forest Committees falling under two forest circles of Madhya Pradesh. A Leadership Style Preference Scale (LSPS) was designed to obtain the preference ranking of people and forest officers for four possible leadership styles, charismatic, authoritative, nurturant and participative. The results indicate that both villagers and forest officers shared the common preferences towards charismatic and authoritative styles. However, villagers had a greater preference for nurturant style while forest personnel had indicated a little greater preference for participative style. In keeping with the local and national culture of affiliation and personalised relationships, results strongly support the hypothesis of culture-led leadership. The study has implications for the sustained efficacy of the JFM programme through effective leadership of forest personnel. Una Escala de Preferencia de Estilo de Liderazgo (LSPS) se diseo para obtener la clasificacin sobre la preferencia de la gente y de funcionarios forestales de 4 estilos de liderazgo: Carismtico, Autoritativo, Amigable y Participativo. 42609327|Silvicultural pruning aims to improve wood quality by producing knot-free timber known as clearwood. Production of clearwood is maximized by early and severe pruning treatments. However, pruning too severely reduces stem growth and may affect tree dominance in the stand. Most pruning prescriptions are empirical in nature, and combine operational requirements with stem growth responses to various pruning treatments. However, responses to pruning are influenced by site fertility, water availability and climate. It is not easy to account for these using an empirical approach, and consequently empirical prescriptions tend to be restricted in their application. In order to optimize clearwood production across a range of sites and environmental conditions it is necessary to take a physiological approach, where biomass production and partitioning, and leaf development, can be accounted for. In this paper growth responses to pruning are explained in physiological terms, and the possible effects of site and environment on those responses discussed. The use of simple physiological measures as silvicultural management tools, and the integration of empirical and physiological approaches to developing pruning prescriptions are outlined. Cependant, laguer trop svrement rduit la croissance du tronc et peut affecter la dominance de l'arbre dans la plantation. Nanmois, les rponses  l'lagage sont influences par la fertilit du site, la disponibilit de l'eau et le climat. Il n'est pas facile de prendre en compte ces facteurs en utilisant une approche empirique, et, par consquent, les prescriptions empiriques ont tendance  tre restreintes dans leur application. Pour optimiser la production de "clearwood" sur une varit de sites et de conditions environnementales, il est ncessaire d'adopter une approche physiologique, o la production et la divisiond de la biomasse, et le dveloppement des feuilles, peuvent tre expliqus. Dans cet artice, les rponses de croissance  l'lagage sont expliques en termes physiologiques, et les effets possibles des sites et de l'environnement sur ces rponses sont examines. L'utilisation de simples mesures physiologiques comme outil de grance sylviculturelle et l'intgration d'approches empiriques et physiologiques pour dvelopper les prescriptions d'lagage sont soulignes. La poda silvicultural que intenta mejorar la calidad de la madera mediante la produccin de maderos libres de nudos se conoce con el nombre de madera libre de nudos. La produccin de madera libre de nudos se maximiza por tratamientos de poda tempranos y severos. Sin embargo, la poda demasiado severa reduce grandemente el crecimiento del tallo y puede afectar la dominancia del rbol en pie. La mayora de las prescripciones para podas son empricas en naturaleza, y combinan los requisitos operacionales con respuestas de crecimiento del tallo a diversos tratamientos de poda. Sin embargo, estas respuestas a la poda pueden estar influenciados por la fertilidad del sitio, la disponibilidad de agua y el clima. No es fcil de explicar estos utilizando un enfoque emprico, y como consecuencia las prescripciones empricas tienden a ser restringidas en su aplicacin. Con el fin de optimizar la produccin de madera libre de nudos, a travs de un rango de sitios y condiciones medio ambientales es necesario tomar un enfoque fisiolgico, donde puedan tenerse en cuenta la produccin y distribucin de biomasa y el desarrollo foliar. En este artculo, las respuestas de crecimiento a la poda se explican en trminos fisiolgicos, y se discuten los posibles efectos de sitio y de entorno en estas respuestas. Se esbozan el uso de medidas fisiolgicas simples como herramientas de manejo silviculturales, y la integracin de enfoques empricos y fisiolgicos al desarrollo de prescripciones de poda.

43739712|An emphasis on global markets for non-timber forest products (NTFPs) often overshadows attention to the local trade in many traditionally important products. 43739635|The Bolivian forestry law requires that 10 per cent of areas under forest management must be set aside as 'ecological reserves', serving as protected areas from resource extraction. These guidelines appear to be based largely on reserve design theory from the conservation biology literature including recommendations for large, contiguous blocks of reserves interconnected with other protected areas through corridor networks. Such recommendations, however, are largely applicable to protected areas that are embedded within fragmented landscapes or where there is significant threat of deforestation. In contrast, protected areas within managed forests in Bolivia are surrounded by areas of largely intact forest subjected to low-intensity reduced impact logging and where logging occurs with a felling cycle not less than 20 years. Following an analysis of the current Bolivian law, conservation goals, and pertinent literature, we argue that issues of size and connectivity are perhaps less important within landscapes dominated by areas under forest management for timber production compared to protected areas imbedded within fragmented landscapes. It may, therefore, be more effective to disperse ecological reserves throughout management units to protect critical habitat and sites prone to damage from logging. La loi de foresterie bolivienne requiert que 10% des zones sous gestion forestire soient mises de ct comme "Rserves cologiques", pour servir de zones protges de l'extraction des ressources. Ces lignes de conduite semblent tre bases largement sur une thorie maquette de rserve issue de la littrature de biologie de conservation, et comprennent des recommendations pour tablir de grands blocs continus de rserves connects  d'autres zones protges par un ensemble de corridors. Ces recommendations sont cependant largement applicables aux zones protges au coeur de paysages fragments, ou aux zones en fort danger de dboisement. Par contraste, les zones protges au sein des forts sous gestion en Bolivie sont entoures de zones de fort largement intactes sujettes  une coupe de bois  faible intensit et  impact rduit, et, quand la coupe s'opre, elle poursuit un cycle de 20 ans au moins. A la suite d'une analyse de la loi bolivienne actuelle, des buts de conservation et de la littrature approprie, nous dmontrons que les questions de taille et de connectivit sont peut-tre moins importantes dans un paysage domin par des zones sous gestion forestire pour la production du bois, que dans des zones protges au sein de paysages fragments. Il serait peut-tre par consquent plus efficace de disperser les rserves cologiques  travers les units de gestion pour protger les habitats critiques et les sites vulnrables lors de la coupe du bois. La Ley Forestal boliviana requiere que un diez por ciento de las reas forestales gestionadas debe ser conservado en forma de 'reservas ecolgicas', zonas protegidas de la extraccin de recursos. Parece que estas pautas son basadas en la teora de diseo de reservas expresada en el material publicado sobre conservacin biolgica, ya que incluye recomendaciones para grandes bosques contiguos de reservas interconectados con otras zonas protegidas mediante redes de corredores ecolgicos. Sin embargo, estas recomendaciones fueron diseadas para reas protegidas dentro de paisajes fragmentados, o donde existe una amenaza significativa de deforestacin. En cambio, las zonas protegidas en bosques gestionados en Bolivia suelen ser rodeadas de reas forestales en su mayora intactas y sujetas a tala de baja intensidad e impacto reducido, donde la tala sigue un ciclo no menor de viente aos. Despus de una evaluacin de la legislacin boliviana actual, de los objetivos de la conservacin y del material publicado relevante, se sugiere que los temas de tamao e interconectividad pueden ser menos importantes dentro de paisajes forestales gestionados en mayor parte para la produccin de madera que en zonas protegidas dentro de paisajes fragmentados. Por eso puede resultar ms eficaz proteger el hbitat crtico y los lugares susceptibles a sufrir daos causados por la tala a travs de la distribucin de las reservas ecolgicas por la totalidad de las reas gestionadas.

Le renforcement des lois forestires risque d'avoir un impact sur les moyens d'existence des communauts forestires. Il construit sur la base d'une analyse de la littrature et d'un rapport d'expert. Les questions suivantes sont identifies comme tant les plus  mme d'tre capables d'influencer les impacts sur les moyens d'existence du VPA: services environnementaux et ressources forestires amliors, rformes de la proprit des terres et des arbres, transparence et prise de responsabilit accrues, et consultation et participation des parties prenantes dans la gestion forestire. Resulta probable que la consolidacin de la aplicacin de las leyes forestales tenga un impacto sobre la vida y el sustento de las comunidades del bosque. Este estudio examina el concepto del sustento en el contexto del Acuerdo Voluntario de Asociacin (AVA) del Plan de Accin para la Aplicacin de Leyes, Gobernanza y Comercio Forestales (FLEGT) y su impacto esperado sobre la vida de las comunidades que viven en los bosques de Ghana. El impacto del AVA sobre el sustento de las comunidades variar para grupos sociales diferentes, y se espera que los grupos pobres sern ms afectados que los grupos ms ricos. 43739510|This paper critically examines the application of a decentralisation principle in the community forestry (CF) programme of Nepal and discusses the implications of decentralisation efforts. Decentralisation applied in the forestry sector is devolution, which involves the transfer of functions or decision-making authority. The Local Self-Governance Act (LSGA) 1999 provides the framework for decentralised governance in Nepal. While assessing the LSGA 1999 and Forest Act 1993, it emerges that in many instances, forest legislation bypasses the local government. There exist conflicts and contradictions between the FA 1993 and LSGA 1999 which adds further confusion in the community forestry programme. Local government (LG) has always claimed any natural resources lying within its jurisdiction and initiated claiming ownership of the forest situated in their jurisdiction as per LSGA 1999. But local communities or community forestry user groups (CFUGs) reject any move of the government leading towards handing over of the forests to the LGs. Nevertheless they want an active role of the LGs in the community forestry programme, mainly in user group identification. Sustainable management of the forests is unlikely without the constructive support, cooperation and active role of the LGs. Thus, role clarification between different actors and stakeholders of CFs, especially LGs, user groups and District Forest Officers with regard to CF is essential to put decentralisation into practice. 24309850|Forest certification is intended to be a market-based incentive to promote the sustainability of forest lands and forest management. However, undertaking a certification can be a costly exercise, and the economic benefits may not be immediately clear. The three most important market benefits are potentially market access, improved public image and price premiums. Although forest certification has achieved major progress by enabling certified forest products to penetrate some environmentally sensitive market niches and by maintaining and enhancing the public image of forestry companies, the price premum has proved difficult to realize, especially for commodity products such as pulp and structural lumber. When considering the actual purchasing behaviour of consumers, there is little evidence to verify that the expressed willingness to pay a price premium will materialize in the market place. Considerable uncertainty exists as to why this might be the case, and the presence of too high a premium could drive consumers towards cheaper products derived from unsustainable (or illegal) forestry activities. La certification forestire est sense tre un encouragement de march pour promouvoir la durabilit des terres forestires et la gestion forestire. Cependant, organiser une certification peut-tre un exercice coteux, et ses bnfices conomiques peuvent ne pas tre immdiatement clairs. Les trois bnfices de march les plus importants sont potentiellement l'accs au march, une image publique amliore et une augmentation des prix. Bien que la certification forestire ait accompli des progrs majeurs en permettant aux produits de forts certifies de pntrer dans les niches de march sensibles  l'environnement, et en maintenant et renforant l'image publique des compagnies forestires, l'augmentation des prix s'est trouv tre difficile  raliser, en particulier pour les produits de marchandise comme la pulpe et le bois de structure. En examinant la conduite d'achat relle des consommateurs, on trouve peu de preuves qu'une attitude favorable  l'ide de payer un prix premium se matrialise sur le march. La raison de ce paradoxe est considrablement incertaine, et la prsence d'un prix trop lev risque de pousser les consommateurs vers des produits meilleur march drivs d'activits de foresterie non durables ou illgales. El objetivo de la certificacin forestal debe ser la provisin de un incentivo basado en el mercado para as promover la gestin forestal y la sostenibilidad de las tierras forestales. Sin embargo, un proceso de certificacin puede resultar bastante costoso a nivel financiero, y puede que los beneficios econmicos no queden claros de forma inmediata. Los beneficios comerciales ms importantes son, potencialmente, el acceso a los mercados, una mejora de imagen pblica y la posibilidad de venderse a un precio superior. Aunque la certificacin forestal ha logrado progresos considerables al facilitar la penetracin de productos forestales certificados de algunos nichos de mercado que priman el rendimiento ambiental, y al mantener y mejorar la imagen pblica de las empresas forestales, ha resultado difcil conseguir un recargo en el precio, sobre todo en el caso de productos base como la pulpa de madera y la madera destinada a fines estructurales. Al considerar los comportamientos de los consumidores a la hora de comprar, existen pocas pruebas de que se hagan realidad en el mercado las expresiones de buena volunted en cuanto a pagar un precio superior. Hay bastante incertidumbre sobre las razones detrs de esta dicotoma, y la presencia de un recargo demaisado alto podra empujar a los consumidores hacia productos ms econmicos derivados de actividades forestales no sostenibles (o incluso ilegales).

It will also affect the viability of plantation forests established in drier areas to combat desertification. Many forests are showing increased productivity, although the causes remain unclear. Sea-level change will destabilize coastal forests, particularly mangroves, reducing their effectiveness in coastal protection. Air pollution has already destabilized many forests, and is likely to be an increasing problem in the forests surrounding urban areas in developing countries. 24309851|In Cameroon, resources such as non-wood forest products are often managed as common pool resources in customary systems, which have been variously influenced by changes in policy, demographics and market opportunities. This research explored the effects of increasing commercialisation on the customary management systems for three commercially important species, Gnetum spp. (Gnetum), Irvingia spp. (bush mango) and Ricinodendron heudelotii (njansang) in two areas differentiated on the basis of level of commercialisation. Findings showed that increased commercialisation was leading to overharvesting of these products, particularly Gnetum. The customary rules of access were also changing as the perception of improved marketing opportunities was leading to restrictions on access to bush mango and Gnetum. The increasing privatisation of access for njansang has removed it from the common pool, which could negatively affect those women, with insecure access to land, who depend on its harvest and sale as a source of livelihood. 24310682|Since 1992, the Vietnamese Government has implemented far reaching policies and programs to increase the country's tree cover by promoting plantation forestry. In addition to providing environmental services, these efforts are intended to alleviate rural poverty through sustainable forestry. Towards this goal, more than 4 million ha have been assigned to households and rural cooperatives through forestland reallocation or management contracts. Although the extent of primary forest has continued to decrease, overall tree cover has increased by 47% since 1990, largely due to the spread of tree plantations. Meanwhile, in the last decade, with Vietnam's economic liberalisation policies, the timber processing industry has shifted from State-owned enterprises to private companies. By 2008, the processing sector had expanded into a $3 billion industry, one of Vietnam's top five export sectors and a major source of demand for logs and sawnwood. In 2010, an assessment in the industrial wood processing center of Binh Dinh province was conducted to gain insights on market opportunities for smallholder produced timber. The assessment revealed a number factors preventing local smallholders from fully capitalising on demand for wood from the processing industry. These included competition between the manufacturing sectors (e.g. furniture, woodchips and pulp industries), which creates an incentive for premature timber harvesting, and a lack of domestic supply of certified timber, resulting in Vietnam's furniture companies importing raw materials. To address the former, better segmentation of the wood production for the different sectors is recommended. The latter might be addressed through more aggressive efforts to certify household-scale timber plantations through simplified schemes such as the Forest Stewardship Council's Small and Low Intensity Managed Forests (SLIMF) certification, pending additional research to better understand the potential costs, benefits and risks of such a strategy. 24309822|In China, high feedstock cost and supply logistics constrain the development of the wood bioenergy sector.
