Par consquent, les moyens de subsistance locaux ont t ngativement affects. Par ailleurs, la corruption apparat comme endmique. Il en a rsult parmi les populations locales une forte majorit qui exprime des attitudes ngatives  l'gard des socits d'exploitation forestire et de l'Etat. Les populations locales considrent que les ONG ont un potentiel important pour amliorer leurs relations avec les socits forestires, tandis que des droits garantis aux usagers ont t identifis comme le plus important moyen d'amliorer leur relation avec l'tat. Garantir les droits de la communaut locale aux ressources foncires et forestires, y compris l'accs et l'utilisation des droits pour les forts permanentes ou zones de concession  apparait comme essentiel  la rsolution des conflits et au dveloppement conomique et social local. Este estudio identifica las causas de conflictos relacionados con el bosque en la pluviselva ecuatorial del sureste de Camern, por medio de estudios de campo realizados en tres pueblos donde han sido aprobadas concesiones de aprovechamiento. El acceso de las comunidades locales al bosque se ha visto reducido severamente y los derechos comunales consuetudinarios han sido restringidos como resultado de un plan nacional de zonificacin de reas forestales. En consecuencia, los medios de subsistencia locales se han visto afectados negativamente. La corrupcin esta a su vez proliferando, lo cual ha provocado que la gran mayora de la poblacin local muestre actitudes negativas hacia las compaas madereras y el estado. Significativamente hablando, los vecinos perciben en las ONG un gran potencial para mejorar su relacin con las compaas madereras, mientras que asegurar los derechos de los usuarios fue la va identificada para mejorar su relacin con el estado. El asegurar los derechos de la comunidad a la tierra y los recursos forestales  inclusive el acceso y los derechos de uso permanentes a los bosques y concesiones forestales parecen ser esenciales para la resolucin de conflictos y el subsiguiente desarrollo econmico y social.
43739431|An increase in the use of operations research techniques for forest-level planning, as expressed by publication of papers in peerreviewed North American forestry journals, is illustrated by the number of papers published that describe a mathematical problem formulation, or model used, and demonstrates an application of the planning process. A shift in planning from a dependence on linear programming to heuristics is evidenced through the literature review, although linear programming and its derivatives continue to be used to demonstrate the development of strategic forest plans, plans without spatial components, or relaxed solutions to more complex forest planning problems. Initially, wood production and economic goals dominated the themes of journal articles, but just as the forest management environment has evolved to include an explicit recognition of non-timber goals, so have mathematical programming techniques evolved to support the development of forest plans with non-timber goals. Spatial components within forest planning processes have also increased dramatically in the last decade, as resource goals that key off of the juxtaposition of activities have become increasingly important. Finally, two North American forestry journals, the Canadian Journal of Forest Research and Forest Science, have become the predominant sources of forest-level planning literature that focuses on forest planning problem formulations and examples of the use of mathematical programming techniques in forest-level planning. Un accroissement de l'utilisation de techniques de recherche dans le domaine des oprations pour la planification au niveau forestier est visible de par la publication d'articles dans les revues de foresterie professionnels en Amrique du Nord. Il est illustr par le nombre d'articles publis qui dcrivent des formulations de problmes mathmatiques ou un modle utilis, et dmontrent une application du processus de planification. Bien que la programmation linaire et ses drivs continuent  tre utiliss pour dmontrer le dveloppement des plans de forts stratgiques, des plans sans lments d'ordre spatial, ou des solutions moins rigides aux problmes de planification forestire plus complexes; la revue littraire atteste que la planification s'carte de la dpendance sur la programmation linaire pour s'approcher de plus en plus de l'heuristique. La production de bois et les buts conomiques dominaient initialement les thmes des articles publis, alors que les techniques de programmation mathmatiques ont volu a prsent pour soutenir le dveloppement des plans forestiers  buts exclusivement autres que le bois, paralllement  l'volution s'tant opre vers l'inclusion d'une reconnaissance explicite des buts autres que le bois dans le domaine de la planification forestire. Les lments d'ordre spatial se sont accrus radicalement dans les processus de planification forestire ces dix dernires annes, alors que les buts de ressource incorporant la juxtaposition des activits sont devenus de plus en plus importants. Deux revues de foresterie Nord-Amricaines, le "Canadian Journal of Forest Research" et "Forest Science", sont devenues les sources prdominantes de littrature de planification au niveau forestier se concentrant sur les formulations des problmes de planification forestire et produisant des exemples d'utilisation des techniques de programmation mathmatique dans la planification au niveau forestier. Tal como indica la publicacin de artculos en las revistas forestales especializadas de Amrica del Norte, el aumento del uso de tcnicas de investigacin operacional en la planificacin forestal se demuestra en el gran nmero de artculos publicados que describen una formulacin de tipo matemtico, o un modelo utilizado, y que muestran una aplicacin del proceso de planificacin. En el material publicado se nota un cambio en la planificacin, un alejamiento de la programacin lineal y un movimiento hacia la heurstica, aunque la programacin lineal y sus derivados siguen siendo usados para demostrar el desarrollo de planes forestales estratgicos, planes sin componentes espaciales, o soluciones informales para problemas de planificacin ms complejos. Al principio, la produccin de madera y los objetivos econmicos dominaron en los artculos de las revistas, pero tal como el entorno del manejo forestal ha evolucionado para abarcar un reconocimiento explcito de los objetivos no relacionados con la produccin de madera, las tcnicas de programacin matemtica han asimismo evolucionado para apoyar el desarrollo de planes forestales que tengan objetivos parecidos. En la ltima dcada se ha presenciado tambin un aumento significativo en el uso de componentes espaciales, ya que se han hecho cada vez ms importantes los objetivos basados en la yuxtaposicin de actividades y de recursos. Por ltimo, dos revistas forestales norteamericanas, el Canadian Journal of Forest Research y Forest Science, han llegado a ser las fuentes ms importantes de material publicado centrado en las formulaciones para problemas de planificacin forestal y en ejemplos del uso de tcnicas de programacin matemtica en la planificacin forestal.
43739763|Forests have returned to the international political agenda as governments deliberate on the successor to the Kyoto Protocol. Yet forest scientists are ill-equipped to answer the questions raised in these discussions, since their concepts and practices are less applicable at global scales. This article outlines key elements of a new global forest science that could answer these questions. It would, for example, monitor the world's forests annually, just as astronomers observe the universe; show how to construct reliable global knowledge about forests; devise methods to identify normative long-term trends in national forest cover to make a Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation (REDD) Scheme feasible; improve our understanding of the role of forests in global environmental governance; and map biodiversity and carbon stocks holistically so that combating climate change does not undermine biodiversity. Les forts sont sur l'agenda politique mondial, alors que les gouvernements rflchissent sur ce que sera le successeur du protocole de Kyoto. Cependant, les scientifiques de la fort ne sont pas quips pour rpondre aux questions que les crateurs de politique posent  prsent, puisque leurs pratiques et conceptes sont moins applicables aux niveau national et global. Cet article souligne certains principes cls d'une nouvelle science de la fort globale qui pourrait rpondre  ces questions. Ces principes pourraient par exemple surveiller les forts du monde annuellement, tout comme les astonomes examinent l'univers, montrer comment faire grandir une connaissance globale des forts, tant donn que les courants  long terme du couvert forestier dans diffrents pays ne sont pas synchroniss, crer des mthodes pour identifier les courants  long terme normatifs dans le couvert forestier national, pour permettre au projet de rduction des missions provenant de la deforestation et de la dgradation des forts (REDD) d'tre applicable, et identifier la biodiversit et le stock de carbone de faon holistique, afin que le combat contre le changement climatique ne nuise pas  la biodiversit. En este momento los gobiernos deliberan sobre el sucesor del Protocolo de Kioto, y los bosques constituyen un asunto poltico prioritario a nivel mundial. Sin embargo, los cientficos forestales no estn equipados para dar respuesta a las preguntas planteadas ahora por los responsables de formular polticas, ya que sus conceptos y prcticas no se pueden aplicar tan fcilmente a una escala nacional o mundial. Este artculo explica algunos de los principios claves de una nueva ciencia forestal global capaz de dar respuesta a estas preguntas. Esta ciencia llevara a cabo, por ejemplo, una monitorizacin anual de los bosques mundiales, tal como los astrnomos observan el universo. Demostrara como construir un banco global de conocimientos confiables sobre los bosques, dado que las tendencias de la cobertura forestal a largo plazo no son sincronizadas en diferentes pases. Ideara adems mtodos para identificar tendencias normativas de la cobertura forestal a largo plazo, lo cual hara factible un Programa de Reduccin de Emisiones por Deforestacin y Degradacin (REDD). 43739801|Collaborative Forest Management (CFM) has attracted significant attention in Asia in recent years, with around 25 percent of forests currently outside direct State management. Advocates of CFM suggest that it has the potential to achieve sustainable forest management in a way that improves the welfare of the rural poor. Whether this potential is realised in practice largely depends on the type and scale of benefits created through CFM relative to costs, whether communities are able to secure any of these, and how they are distributed locally. This paper provides an overview of benefit sharing from community-managed forests in Asia based on a recent joint initiative of some key international CFM support organisations. The paper examines why the flow of benefits from community-managed forests to local actors is lower than it could be, highlighting institutional and policy constraints that need to be addressed for this to change, as well as the role and arrangement of community-level governance. El Manejo Forestal Colaborativo (CFM, por sus siglas en ingls) ha atrado bastante inters en Asia en los ltimos aos, y en la actualidad aproximadamente un 25% de los bosques no se encuentra bajo la gestin directa del Estado. 43740364|International discussions on forest issues emerged in the 1980s, mostly due to the activism of environmental NGOs. Forest negotiations proved particularly contentious in the Rio Summit. The post-Rio period witnessed a gradual dynamism towards the development of consensus. The consensus-building process at the UN led to the establishment of the Intergovernmental Panel on Forests. The process was further pursued through the establishment of the Intergovernmental Forum on Forests and the United Nations Forum on Forests. The present paper sheds light on international forest negotiations from 1992 to 2007. The paper, drawing also on the personal experiences and reflections of the author, posits that effective pursual and implementation of international agreements on forests will depend on the continued active engagement of the NGOs and other stakeholders involved. It is further suggested that genuine multilateralism calls for political will, meaningful engagement of all stakeholders, and the provision of requisite resources and means of implementation. Le processus fut poursuivi plus en profondeur avec l'tablissement du forum intergouvernemental sur les forts, et le forum des Nations-Unies sur les forts. Il avance galement, et ce, en se basant aussi sur les expriences et les reflections personnelles de l'auteur, que la poursuite et la mise en pratique des accords internationaux sur les forts va dpendre de l'engagement actif continu des organisations non gouvernementales et des autres parties prenantes impliques. Il est ensuite propos que le multilatralisme rel ncessite une volont politique, une participation consquente de toutes les parties prenantes, l'exigence de ressources ncessaires et les moyens de les mettre en pratique. Los debates internacionales sobre temas forestales se iniciaron en la dcada de 1980, sobre todo debido al activismo de ONGs del sector ecologista, y las negociaciones forestales fueron especialmente polmicas en la cumbre de Rio. En el perodo posterior a la cumbre de Rio se vio movimiento dinmico hacia el desarrollo de un consenso, y este proceso, bajo los auspicios de Naciones Unidas, lleg a la creacin del Grupo Intergubernamental ad hoc sobre los Bosques (IPF). 24310576|In the context of the changing needs of the professional forester market and the reforms in European higher education, this study examined the possible shortcomings in forestry university programmes. We compared the views of 18 employers and 25 universities regarding European Master education through a survey that examined 42 competencies. Generally, employers and universities provided similar assessments regarding the importance of competencies and the gap between their achievement in higher education and the market needs. Environmental services, carbon sequestration, and the ability to communicate with specialists and non-specialists were competencies where both employers and universities saw the greatest need for emphasis. Employers identified, as compared to universities, greater gaps in bioenergy, products trade and marketing, economics, and governance. Universities, in turn, placed a greater emphasis on the importance of generic competencies such as capacity to learn. These and other findings provide potential value for the development of forestry curricula. 43740279|Solomon Islands is recovering from a period of civil war that has contributed to a rate of harvesting of its natural forests that far exceeds the sustainable level of cut. This over-cutting means that within a decade the country faces a 15-year period during which it will be unable to produce commercial quantities of timber from its natural forests. As the forest industry is a major component of the economy this will have serious consequences. Plantations have the potential to bridge this resource gap. Because of the land tenure system it is difficult to establish large-scale commercial plantations. The AusAID funded Forestry Management Project and the Forestry Division of the Ministry of Forestry, Environment and Conservation have successfully encouraged individuals and families to plant high value trees. If the current planting rate of 1000 hectares per year can be maintained then this will ensure the survival of the forest industry. 24310502|China is one of the poorest countries with respect to per capita water resources, and water resources have become an increasingly more important factor restricting the development of China. Virtual water theory provides new ideas and new ways to improve water use efficiency, and to ease water shortages. This paper estimated the virtual water contents of two forests types using the water consumption of forest transpiration with representative species, and thus calculated the virtual water content of primary woody products by using the production tree method, then analyzed the virtual water trade of primary woody products in China. The results show that woody products are water-intensive products, and woody products trade is associated with a huge amount of virtual water trade. The virtual water trade of China's primary woody products belongs to the net imports, but its structure need further be optimized. La Chine figure parmi les pays les plus pauvres en termes de ressources en eau par habitant, facteur de plus en plus important qui entrave le dveloppement de la Chine. La thorie de l'eau virtuelle est source de nouvelles ides et mthodes visant l'amlioration de l'efficacit de l'utilisation de l'eau, et la rduction des pnuries d'eau. Dans le prsent document, une estimation des teneurs en eau virtuelle de deux types de forts a t tablie au moyen de la consommation de l'eau issue de la transpiration de ces forts prsentant des espces reprsentatives, et la teneur en eau virtuelle des produits ligneux primaires a ainsi t calcule  l'aide de la mthode de l'arborescence de production. Une analyse du commerce d'eau virtuelle li aux produits ligneux primaires en Chine a ensuite t mene. Selon les conclusions, les produits ligneux consomment beaucoup d'eau, et le commerce de ces derniers constitue un norme volume d'changes d'eau virtuelle. Le commerce d'eau virtuelle li aux produits ligneux primaires de la Chine relve des importations nettes, mais sa structure doit tre optimise davantage. China es uno de los pases ms pobres con respecto a los recursos hdricos per capita, los cuales se han convertido en un factor de restriccin del desarrollo cada vez ms importante en China. La teora del agua virtual aporta nuevas ideas y nuevas maneras de mejorar la eficiencia en el uso del agua, y de aliviar la escasez de este recurso. Este artculo ha estimado los contenidos de agua virtual de dos tipos de bosque utilizando el consumo hdrico por transpiracin causado por especies representativas de cada tipo de bosque, y de este modo ha calculado el contenido de agua virtual de los productos primarios de la madera utilizando el mtodo del "rbol de produccin" (cadena de produccin). A continuacin, el artculo muestra el anlisis del comercio de agua virtual de productos primarios de la madera en China. Los resultados muestran que los productos de la madera son productos con un uso intensivo del agua, y que el comercio de los mismos est ligado a un enorme comercio de agua virtual. El comercio de agua virtual de productos primarios de la madera en China muestra tpicamente importaciones netas, pero su estructura requiere continuar con su optimizacin.
24310468|The paper focuses on mobilizing resources through forestry activity in Liberia and Gabon. It advocates the management of forests in a sustainable manner while obtaining a fair share of rents arising from their exploitation. The paper describes the performance of a generalized area tax through a bidding process for allocating concessions in Liberia and presents the status of forestry taxation in Gabon. Both countries through reform have greatly simplified the fiscal terms for the industry, and further improvements are feasible. A deepening of the reform should consider phasing out export taxation and the consolidation of an area tax and auctions for allocating concessions. L'article se penche sur la mobilisation des ressources fiscales  travers l'activit forestire au Liberia et au Gabon. Il se situe du point de vue de la gestion durable des forts tout en visant une distribution quitable des revenus issus de leur exploitation. L'article envisage les effets d'une redevance unique, base sur la superficie et fixe par le biais d'un processus d'enchres dans l'allocation des concessions au Libria et, il dcrit, par ailleurs, les caractristiques de la situation actuelle de la fiscalit forestire au Gabon. Les deux pays ont normment simplifi les rgles fiscales de l'industrie par des rformes et d'autres amliorations restent  faire. Un approfondissement de la rforme devrait considrer une diminution de la taxe  l'exportation, le renforcement de la redevance de superficie et l'utilisation d'enchres pour l'allocation des concessions. Este estudio se centra en la movilizacin de recursos a travs de la actividad forestal en Liberia y Gabn. Se apuesta por seguir una poltica de gestin forestal sostenible y al mismo tiempo obtener los beneficios apropiados de la renta que proporciona su explotacin. El estudio describe el rendimiento de un impuesto local generalizado derivado de un proceso de pujas para el reparto de concesiones en Liberia y presenta el estado del rgimen fiscal forestal en Gabn. Ambos pases han llevado a cabo un proceso de reforma para simplificar las condiciones fiscales en la industria, y la realizacin de cambios ulteriores parece factible. Una profundizacin de la reforma debera considerar la eliminacin gradual de los impuestos sobre la exportacin y la consolidacin de un impuesto local y un sistema de pujas para el reparto de concesiones.
42609931|The objectives and principles of the RIL techniques in the tropics are described and a review presented of the most important results of research carried out on the impact of logging on the remaining stand and forest dynamics. The main objective of RIL techniques is to reduce substantially disturbances to soil and residual vegetation in comparison with conventional logging. RIL is mainly based on close planning and control of all harvesting operations. The amount of logging damage not only depends on the techniques used but also on logging intensity. In Africa, logging damage is usually slight because harvesting intensity rarely exceeds 2 trees per ha. The extreme picture is found in South East Asia where logging intensity averages 9 trees per ha; this involves damage which can affect half of the forest stand. With such logging intensities, RIL techniques are not efficient in reducing damage significantly. L'auteur dcrit les objectifs et principes majeurs des techniques d'EFIR en zone tropicale et passe en revue les rsultats des principales recherches concernant l'impact de l'exploitation forestire sur les peuplements rsiduels et la dynamique forestire. L'objectif premier des techniques d'EFIR est de rduire substantiellement la perturbation des sols et de la vgtation rsiduelle par rapport  l'exploitation forestire conventionnelle. L'EFIR repose principalement sur une planification et un contrle serrs de toutes les oprations de rcolte. L'importance des dommages dus  l'exploitation forestire dpend non seulement des techniques utilises mais aussi de l'intensit de l'exploitation. En Afrique, ceux-ci sont gnralement faibles, l'intensit de la rcolte dpassant rarement 2 arbres par hectare.  l'autre extrme, en Asie du Sud-Est, l'intensit atteint en moyenne 9 arbres par hectare et peut endommager la moiti des peuplements.  de telles intensits, les techniques d'EFIR ne peuvent rduire les dommages de faon marque. Se describen los principales objetivos y principios de las tcnicas de RIL en los trpicos y se presenta una revisin de los resultados ms importantes de la investigacin llevada cabo sobre el impacto de la tala en las hileras remanentes y la dinmica del bosque. El objetivo principal de las tcnicas de RIL es reducir sustancialmente los daos al suelo y a la vegetacin residual en comparacin la tala convencional. El RIL se basa principalmente en una estrecha planeacin y control de todas las operaciones de cosecha. La cantidad de dao de la tala depende de no solamente las tcnicas utilizadas sino tambin la intensidad de la tala. En Africa, el dao de la tala es generalmente ligero debido a que la intensidad de cosecha raramente excede 2 rboles por ha. La imagen extrema se encuentra en Asia sur oriental donde la intensidad de tala es en promedio de 9 rboles por ha; esto adems de el dao que puede afectar a la mitad de las hileras de bosque. Con tales intensidades de tala, las tcnicas de RIL no son eficientes en reducir significativamente los daos.
42609936|Reduced impact logging is only part of the process of bringing the neotropical rain forest into use. To attain sustainable yield and economically viable production, the forest structure and composition has to be changed, a process which may be called domestication. A selection forest structure is highly desirable for management and appears to be attainable in the near future by transformation of the forest through an adaptation of the CELOS Silvicultural System. Results from CELOS research in Suriname since 1967 are discussed, along with an example of the management and silviculture of a commercially based and FSC-certified timber company in the Amazon region. L'exploitation forestire  impact rduit n'est qu'un lment du processus d'exploitation de la fort ombrophile notropicale. Sa transformation en fort jardine, une structure d'amnagement hautement dsirable, pourrait s'effectuer  court terme en adaptant le Systme sylvicole CELOS. L'auteur analyse les rsultats de recherches sur le CELOS menes depuis 1967, au Surinam, et prsente un exemple d'amnagement et de sylviculture pratiqus par une compagnie forestire amazonienne certifie FSC. La tala de impacto reducido es solamente una parte del proceso de usar el bosque lluvioso neotropical. 24309857|Pakistan's remaining forests are both fragile and unique. They are also extremely important for the ecological services that they provide to society. Despite the government's ongoing recognition of the need to increase forest cover since 1955, very little substantive progress has been made. Indeed, deforestation levels have been continuing at an alarming rate, making Pakistan one of the most vulnerable countries in the world to losing its forest resources in the next thirty years. This paper highlights the impact of political and government actions on the forest sector in Pakistan. It describes how the rapid rate of deforestation in the past has been linked to government and administrative failures and discusses the possible impact of forest land transfers on forest loss. It then presents the case of the proposed Patriata Reserved Forest development in 2004 as an example of a situation where provincial governments and institutions attempted to usurp established forest policy and legislation to transfer ecologically endangered forestland for a resort development. Finally, the utility of the existing tools of government for protecting Pakistan's remaining forestlands are discussed. Les forts qui ont survcu au Pakistan sont  la fois fragiles et uniques. Cet article souligne l'impact des actions politiques et gouvernementales dans les secteur forestier au Pakistan. Il dcrit comment le rapide taux de dforestation a t li par le pass  des checs du gouvernement et de l'administration, et il analyse l'impact possible des transferts de terre forestire sur la perte des forts. Il prsente ensuite le cas du dveloppement propos de la fort de rserve Patriata en 2004 comme un exemple d'une situation o les gouvernements provinciaux et les institutions essayrent d'usurper la politique et la lgislation d'une fort tablie pour transfrer une terre forestire cologiquement en danger en un dveloppement de site de vacances. A pesar de la conciencia del gobierno de la necesidad de aumentar la cobertura forestal ya en 1955, se han logrado muy pocos progresos sustanciales. De hecho, el proceso de deforestacin ha continuado a un ritmo alarmante, y as Pakistn ha llegado a ser uno de los pases del mundo con mayor probabilidad de perder sus recursos forestales en los prximos treinta aos. Este estudio analiza el impacto de las acciones polticas y gubernamentales sobre el sector forestal pakistan; describe como el ritmo rpido de deforestacin del pasado ha sido relacionado con los fracasos gubernamentales y administrativos, y discute el posible impacto de la transferencia de tierras forestales sobre la prdida de hbitat. Despus se presenta el caso de la Reserva Forestal de Patriata, propuesta en el ao 2004, como ejemplo de una situacin en que los gobiernos e instituciones provinciales intentaron usurpar la poltica y legislacin forestal establecida con el objetivo de urbanizar tierras forestales de alto valor ecolgico para construir un centro turstico. 43740328|This paper presents India's forest resource knowledge base, briefly mentioning the historic progress and management of forestry. Working plans for the operational planning and management of forests at the district/division levels, though still the main source of information, have been difficult to integrate into state/national strategic planning because of their differing time frames. Assessments of the forest resource for strategic planning using statistically sound field inventory design began in 1965, and were stepped up after the creation of the Forest Survey of India in 1981. Field inventory data are supplemented by two-yearly satellite assessments (since 1987), the last showing the forest cover of India to be 67.7 million ha and the growing stock 4.6 billion m. The database is weak regarding many important parameters. The main suggestions for filling the knowledge gap are: capacity building in the application of modern technology to assessments, institutional strengthening, and networking for better information flow. Cet article prsente la base de connaissance des ressources forestires de l'Inde , en mentionant brivement le processus historique et la gestion de la foresterie. Les valuations des ressources forestires pour la planification stratgique utilisant un schma d'inventaire sur le terrain solide statistiquement commencrent en 1965, et furent renforces aprs la cration de l'Etude des forts de l'Inde en 1981. Des valuations par satellite biannuelles complmentent les donnes d'inventaire sur le terrain depuis 1987 , la dernire montrant que le couvert forestier de l'Inde tait de 67.7 millions d'hectares, et que les plantations en croissance taient de 4.6 billions de m3. La base de donnes est faible pour nombre de paramtres importants. Construire la capacit de l'application de la technologie moderne aux valuations, renforcer les institutions et travailler  tablir un meilleur coulement des informations, sont les principales suggestions offertes pour parer aux lacunes de la connaissance. Este estudio presenta la base de conocimientos sobre los recursos forestales de la India, y menciona de paso el contexto histrico y el manejo forestal. Aunque los esquemas de trabajo para la planificacin operativa y el manejo de bosques a nivel de divisiones y/o distrital an son la fuente principal de informacin, ha resultado difcil integrarlos en la planificacin estratgica estatal y nacional por sus diferentes marcos temporales. El uso de un diseo de inventario de campo de estadsticas confiables en las evaluaciones de recursos forestales para la planificacin estratgica empez en el ao 1965, y el proceso se aceler a partir de la creacin de la Encuesta Forestal de la India (Forest Survey of India) en 1981. Los datos de inventario de campo son complementados por dos evaluaciones anuales por satlite (desde 1987), y la ltima de estas mostr que la cobertura forestal de la India fue de 67,7 millones de hectreas y el stock en crecimiento de 4,6 mil millones de metros cuadrados. La base de datos tiene bastantes deficiencias en cuanto a muchos parmetros importantes. Las principales recomendaciones para remediar esta situacin consisten en la creacin de capacitad en la aplicacin de tecnologa moderna a las evaluaciones, el fortalecimiento de las instituciones y el establecimiento de redes de conexiones para mejorar el flujo de informacin.
43739759|The trade relationship between small-scale growers and processing companies often plays an important role in determining the nature and extent of benefits derived from commercial forestry, and the distribution of these benefits. Many strategies are used by individual small-scale growers, village communities, companies and government agencies to form partnerships to undertake commercial forestry  including outgrower schemes, land leasing by companies, and using intermediary brokers between small-scale growers and processors. This article reports on the key findings of a three-year research project that explored different business partnerships used in commercial forestry in Australia and Indonesia, and identified the critical factors for beneficial and enduring partnerships. The key lessons from this research are that, for many small-scale growers to form successful partnerships with other investors, they need:  increased knowledge of the operations and components of commercial forestry;  improved access to competitive markets;  increased knowledge of the dynamics of forest product markets;  improved capacity of local farmer forest groups to share experiences and information, and build their knowledge of commercial forestry; and  reduced administrative and financial burden imposed by government on small-scale forestry operations. Les relations commerciales entre les petits planteurs et les compagnies de traitement jouent souvent un rle important dans la dtermination de la nature et de l'tendue des bnfices drivs de la foresterie commerciale, et dans la distribution de ces bnfices. Cet article prsente les dcouvertes cls d'un projet de recherche vieux de trois ans qui a explor diffrentes quipes commerciales utilises dans la foresterie commerciale en Australie et en Indonsie. Il identifie les facteurs critiques permettant des quipes fructueuses et durables. Les leons les plus importantes de cette recherche sont que, pour que plusieurs petits planteurs puissent former des quipes qui aient du succs avec d'autres investisseurs, il faut qu'ils aient:  une connaissance accrue des oprations et des lments de la foresterie commerciale;  un accs amlior aux marchs comptitifs;  une connaissance plus pousse de la dynamique des marchs de produits forestiers;  une capacit amliore des groupes de fermiers locaux  partager leurs expriences et leurs informations, et  largir leur comprhension de la foresterie commerciale; et  une rduction du fardeau administratif et financier impos par le gouvernement aux petites oprations forestires. La relacin comercial entre cultivadores a pequea escala y empresas procesadoras desempea a menudo un papel importante en determinar el carcter y alcance de los beneficios derivados de la silvicultura comercial, y la distribucin de estos beneficios. Los individuos que cultivan a pequea escala, las comunidades rurales, las empresas y los organismos gubernamentales utilizan muchas estrategias para formar asociaciones que les permita emprender operaciones de silvicultura comercial, incluyendo planes de franquicia para cultivadores, leasing de terrenos por parte de empresas, y el uso de agentes intermediarios entre cultivadores a pequea escala y empresas procesadoras. Este estudio describe los resultados clave de un proyecto de investigacin de tres aos que explor las diferentes asociaciones comerciales utilizadas en la silvicultura en Australia e Indonesia, e identific los factores crticos para las asociaciones beneficiosas y duraderas. En cuanto a la formacin de asociaciones exitosas entre cultivadores a pequea escala y otros inversionistas, las lecciones ms importantes de esta investigacin demuestran que se necesita:  mayor conocimiento de las operaciones y los componentes de la silvicultura comercial;  mejor acceso a mercados competitivos;  mayor conocimiento de la dinmica de mercados de productos forestales;  mejoras en la capacidad de grupos de cultivadores forestales locales de compartir experiencias e informacin, y fortalecer sus conocimientos de la silvicultura comercial; y  reduccin de cargas administrativas y financieras impuestas por el gobierno a operaciones forestales a pequea escala.
43739590|A combinatorial harvest scheduling model was developed to improve the biodiversity conservation from plantation forests by integrating the connectivity of remnant native forest patches to allow for better movement of wildlife species while considering economic efficiency due to changes in the harvest schedule. The biodiversity goals included in the model are: (1) to create a shifting mosaic of closed-canopy stands that connect the remnant native forest patches, (2) to maximize the amount of interior forest habitat created in the shifting mosaic in each period, and (3) to limit the maximum clear fell area that can be created for any 3-year period. The economic goals are to maximize net present value from timber products while meeting a delivery schedule for the forest products. The model was demonstrated using 8 arbitrary scenarios on a 1905 ha forested area using a simulated data set. The minimum shifting mosaic areas used in these scenarios were: 650, 850, 1050 and 1250ha. The goal for maximizing interior habitat was expressed as a perimeter goal, which compared the ratio of the perimeter of the shifting mosaic area with the perimeter of a circle with equal area. Two values were used for this analysis; one was twice the perimeter of a circle with equal area while the other set the value to 3.33 times the value of a circle with equivalent area. The highest level of protection from these scenarios, a minimum shifting mosaic area of 1250 ha with either perimeter goal, produces approximately 50% less discounted net revenue than the non spatially constrained solution. The smallest shifting mosaic area, 650 ha, lowered discounted net revenue between 16% for the 3.33 perimeter goal and 27% for the 2.0 perimeter goal. These models are useful for policy makers to begin to develop the cost and benefits from various levels of biodiversity protection. Un modle de progammation de rcolte combinatoire a t dvelopp pour amliorer la conservation de la biodiversit des forts de plantation, en intgrant la connectivit des surfaces de forts natives ayant survcu, pour permettre un mouvement plus libre des espces de faune, tout en considrant l'efficacit conomique lie aux changements dans la programmation de la rcolte. Les buts de la biodiversit inclus dans ce modle sont: 1) crer une mosaque mouvante de peuplement  canope ferme qui relie les lots de fort originelle survivante, 2) pour maximiser la dimension de l'habitat de fort intrieur cr par cette mosaque mouvante dans chaque priode, et, 3) pour limiter la surface maximale de coupe totale pouvant tre cre dans chaque priode de trois ans. Les buts conomiques sont de maximiser la valeur prsente nette des produits du bois, tout en assurant un progamme de production pour les produits de la fort. Ce modle a t expos en utilisant 8 scnarios arbitraires sur une zone forestire de 1905 ha en utilisant un ensemble de donnes simul. Les surfaces minimum de mosaque mouvante utilises dans ces scnarios taient: 650, 850, 1050 et 1250 ha. Le but de maximiser l'habitat intrieur tait exprim par un but de primtre qui comparait le rapport du primtre de la zone de mosaque mouvante avec le primtre d'un cercle de surface gale. Deux valeurs ont t utilises pour cette analyse: l'une tait le double du primtre d'un cercle de surface gale, alors que l'autre utilisait la valeur de 3.33 fois la valeur d'un cercle de surface quivalente. Le plus fort degr de protection de ces scnarios, une zone de mosaque mouvante de 1250 avec l'un ou l'autre des buts de primtres, produit approximativement 50% de moins de revenu net rduit que la solution n'tant pas limite spatialement. La plus petite zone de mosaque mouvante, 650 ha, fait baisser le revenu net rduit de 16% pour le but de primtre 3.33  27% pour le but de primtre 2.0. Ces modles sont utiles pour aider les crateurs de lignes de conduite  commencer  dvelopper les cots et bnfices  partir de divers niveaux de protection de la biodiversit. Se desarroll un modelo combinatorio para la programacin de cosechas con el objeto de mejorar la conservacin de la biodiversidad en bosques de plantacin mediante la integracin de la conectividad de zonas residuales de bosque indgena para permitir un mayor movimiento de especies faunsticas, sin olvidar las mejoras en la eficacia econmica debido a los cambios producidos por la programacin de cosechas. Los objetivos de biodiversidad incluidos en el modelo son los siguientes: (1) crear un mosaico cambiante de zonas sin espacios en la capa forestal superior que conecta las reas residuales de bosque indgena, (2) maximizar el rea de hbitat forestal interior creada en el mosaico en cada perodo, y (3) limitar el rea mxima de tala completa en cualquier perodo de tres aos. Los objetivos econmicos consisten en el potenciamiento del valor neto actual de los productos madereros y el cumplimiento con un programa para su entrega. El modelo se demostr en seis escenarios arbitrarios en un rea forestal de 1905 ha, mediante el uso de datos simulados. Las reas mnimas del mosaico cambiante utilizado en estos escenarios fueron de 650, 850, 1050 y 1250 ha. El propsito de maximizar el hbitat interior se expres en trminos de un objetivo de permetro, el cual compar la relacin del permetro del rea de mosaico cambiante con el permetro de un crculo de la misma rea. Se utilizaron dos valores para este anlisis; el primero fue dos veces el permetro de un crculo de la misma rea, y el segundo estableci el valor a 3.33 veces el valor de un crculo de la misma rea. El mayor nivel de proteccin en estos escenarios, un rea mnima de mosaico de 1250 ha con cualquier objetivo de permetro, produce ingresos netos descontados de aproximadamente 50% menos que el de la solucin no restringida a nivel espacial. La menor rea de mosaico cambiante, 650 ha, redujo los ingresos netos descontados entre un 16% para el objetivo de permetro de 3.33 y un 27% para el objetivo de permetro de 2.0. Estos modelos sirven a los encargados de las polticas respectivas para que puedan comenzar a calcular el coste y los beneficios de varios niveles de proteccin de la biodiversidad.
43739509|This paper examines issues that should be addressed in the design of regeneration standards for the sustainable management of boreal mixedwood stands. To illustrate concepts, a new system is proposed for setting boreal mixedwood regeneration standards. The proposed system is developed using a framework for creating standards that derives from the discipline of performance measurement. From a consideration of the goal of regeneration and the key factors that determine goal achievement, three performance measures that operate at the multi-block scale are proposed: i) the percent of the harvested area that is stocked, ii) the percent of the harvested area in mixed (deciduous and coniferous) patches, and iii) the percent of the harvested area dominated by free-growing conifers. Minimum and maximum acceptable levels are chosen for each performance measure. When these measures are within prescribed ranges, harvested areas are considered satisfactorily regenerated, the post-harvest condition is expected to produce the desired future forest, and reforestation is contributing to sustainability. Mixedwood regeneration standards currently used in western Canada are reviewed. The proposed system is compared to mixedwood regeneration standards currently used in British Columbia. Aspects of the proposed system requiring refinement, and insights into the design of regeneration standards provided by the field of performance measurement, are also discussed. Cet articleexamine les questions auxquelles il faut faire face en crant des standards de rgnration pour une gestion durable des peuplements boraux mixtes. Pour illustrer ces concepts, un nouveau systme est propos pour tablir les standards de rgnration des peuplements boraux mixtes. Ce systme est dvelopp en utilisant une mthode pour crer les standards qui drive de la discipline d'valuation d'une performance. En partant d'une considration de la rgnration comme but et des facteurs cl dterminant l'aboutissement  ce but, trois mesures de performance oprant au niveau du "multi-block" sont proposes: i) le pourcentage de la zone de rcolte tant stocke, ii) le pourcentage de la zone de rcolte compos de lots mixtes (feuillus et conifres), et, iii) le pourcentage de la mme zone domin par les conifres poussant naturellement. Des niveaux acceptables minimaux et maximaux sont choisis pour chaque mesure de performance. Quand les mesures s'inscrivent entre ces extrmes, les zones rcoltes sont considres comme tant rgnres de manire satisfaisante. La condition aprs la rcolte est considre propice  l'obtention de la fort future dsire, et le reboisement contribue  la durabilit. Les standards de rgnration des peuplements mixtes utiliss aujourd'hui au Canada Occidental sont examins. 24310495|This is a review of forestry related multi-angular remote sensing which is a recent technology making use of optical remote sensing datasets collected from differing viewing-angles during a short period of time. A particular advantage of these datasets lies in their capability to capture structural information. Since forests can be considered to be one of the most complex natural surfaces of the Earth in terms of horizontal and vertical structure, multi-angular remote sensing is a promising tool which can be used to enhance existing remote-sensing applications in order to extract forest information products. The general concept of multi-angular remote sensing and its relation to radiative transfer models is briefly presented. In the main section the paper gives an overview of multi-angular remote sensing applications in forestry by highlighting relevant publications of the latest years focusing on parameters such as LAI, canopy clumping, biomass, plant-chemical attributes, forest types and species (classification). 43740327|Scientific forestry began in India in 1856 and reached a high standard during colonial times. Management traditions were further improved after Independence, with the emphasis remaining on sustained timber production from state forest reserves. In the mid-1970s under the National Commission on Agriculture, a paradigm shift took place from low-investment, slow-growing forestry to high-investment, fastgrowing forestry. The National Forest Policy 1988 introduced participatory forest management, helping decelerate forest loss, but not stopping it completely. In recent times, two trends are clear: 1) wood production from agro-forestry is significantly higher than from state forests; and 2) non-timber forest products have become more important than timber. These trends would support the Planning Commission of India's (2000-2020) strategy of faster, more inclusive growth. Opportunities, however, need to be carefully embedded within the government forest management system through appropriate policy and institutional adaptations and through increased knowledge and information support to local communities. 43739427|Rubber tree (Hevea brasiliensis (Wild, ex Adr. de Juss.) Muell Arg.) plantations in Malaysia are important sources of natural rubber and wood products. Effective management and appropriate policy for these resources requires reliable forecasts of resource availability. However, to achieve these goals, effective inventories are required. This promoted research into supplementing ground-based survey methods with satellite remote sensing information. A study was conducted to investigate the relationship between Landsat Thematic Mapper (TM) data and rubber stand parameters and to develop and evaluate models for estimating area, volume, and age of rubber plantations. Statistically significant models for estimating volume and age of rubber stands were obtained. For volume models, the R values were all higher than 0.70 and standard error of the estimate (SEE) values were lower than 54 m/ha. R and SEE values achieved from age models evaluated ranged from 0.34-0.64 and 6.4-8.2 years. A logistic regression model produced classifications with an accuracy of 87% for predicting the presence of rubber plantations. Thus, Landsat TM provides an acceptable data source for estimating wood volume and stand age, and for predicting the presence of rubber plantations. 43740941|Foresters need new tools to characterize the internal qualities of individual logs to ensure better wood allocation amongst end-users. Current log sorting procedures are based on sorting logs according to size and visible features. Even when logs are so sorted there is still an enormous natural variability hidden within any particular log pile. Recently it has been shown that low-frequency sound can distinguish amongst such logs according to stiffness. Following from this it was reasoned that fibre characteristics and paper properties might be differentiated on the same basis. This initial study sorted peeler cores according to speed of sound, allocating 250 peeler cores into 18 speed of sound classes. Subsequent pulping and testing showed that fibre length, wet strength and the various properties of handsheets prepared from these 18 sound classes varied in systematic ways. For example, the average fibre length ranged from 1.8 to 2.8 mm at the two extremes of sound classes. Where the sound travelled slowly along the log the fibre length was short and vice versa. Acoustics offers the prospect of better fibre allocation according to end-use. Also with more closely characterized pulps, papers will have more uniform properties. Acoustic tools provide a totally new and effective means of allocating individual logs to the processing for which the wood is best suited. Les forestiers ont besoin de nouveaux outils pour caractriser les qualits intrieures des bches et assurer une meilleure allocation du bois chez les utilisateurs finaux. Les procds de tri des bches sont bass sur les facteurs de la taille et des dtails visibles. Mme quand les bches sont tries de cette faon, il existe toujours une norme variabilit naturelle cache dans chaque pile individuelle de bches. Il a t dmontr rcemment que les sons de basse frquences peuvent permettre de diffrencier entre les bches selon leur raideur. En poussant ce raisonnement plus loin, on se dit que les caractristiques des fibres et les proprits du papier pourraient tre diffrencies de la mme manire. Cette tude initiale tria les coeurs des troncs selon la vitesse du son, classant 250 coeurs dans 18 classes de vitesse du son. La rduction en pte et les tests qui s'ensuivirent montrrent que la longueur des fibres, la force mouille et les proprits diverses des feuilles prpares  partir de ces 18 classes, variaient de faon systmatique. Par exemple: la moyenne de longueur de fibre allait de 1.8  2.8mm aux deux extrmes des classes sonores. Quand le son voyageait lentement le long de la bche, la longueur des fibres restait courte, et vice-versa. L'acoustique offre la possibilit d'une meilleure allocation des fibres selon l'usage final. De plus, avec des pulpes caractrises plus prcisment, les papiers auront des proprits plus uniformes. Les outils acoustiques fournissent des moyens nouveaux et efficaces pour diriger les bches individuellement vers le traitement le mieux adapt  leur bois. Los ingenieros forestales necesitan nuevas herramientas para caracterizar las calidades internas de trozas individuales para garantizar una mejor asignacin de la madera entre los usuarios finales. Los procedimientos actuales de clasificacin de troncos se basan en el tamao y caractersticas visibles. An cuando las trozas han sido clasificadas todava hay una variabilidad natural enorme oculta dentro de una pila de trozas en particular. Recientemente se ha demostrado que el sonido de baja frecuencia puede distinguir entre tales trozas de acuerdo con su rigidez. A partir de este hallazgo se pens que las caractersticas de la fibra y propiedades del papel podra diferenciarse de la misma manera. Este estudio inicial clasific almas de trozas de acuerdo con la velocidad del sonido, asignando 250 almas de trozas en 18 clases de velocidad de sonido. Despus del proceso de despulpado, las pruebas mostraron que la longitud de la fibra, fortaleza en hmedo, y las diversas propiedades de las lminas preparadas de estas 18 clases de sonido variaron de modos sistemticos. Por ejemplo, la longitud promedio de la fibra vari desde 1.8 a 2.8 mm en los dos extremos de clases de sonido. Donde el sonido viaj lentamente a lo largo del tronco, la longitud de la fibra fue corta y viceversa. La acstica ofrece la perspectiva de una mejor asignacin de fibra de acuerdo con uso final. Tambin con pulpas mejor caracterizadas, el papel tendr propiedades ms uniformes. Las herramientas acsticas proveen una manera totalmente nueva y efectiva de asignar trozas individuales de acuerdo con el procesamiento para el que sean ms apropiados.
24309853|Land is of critical importance for provision of wood and nonwood forest products and environmental services. Ownership is a key factor influencing forest land management and protection. Most forests in the world, 86%, are in public ownership which accounts for a commensurate share of forest degradation. U.S. forest land ownership is dominated by private owners, and this has largely worked well for production and for provision of environmental services. International comparisons of forest land ownership and corresponding management outcomes indicate that private forests provide proportionally more market based goods such as wood, and that their environmental performance in terms of forest management plans, forest certification, and compliance with forest regulations appears to be similar to that of public forests. In fact, private lands have increased environmental conformance with regulations and adopted forest certification for many high production lands. Both public and private lands should more closely link tenure rights and conservation and management control. Government ownership and incentives must evolve for both private and public lands to produce forest goods and services more efficiently and equitably. La terre est d'une importance critique pour fournir les produits forestiers en bois, et ceux autres que le bois et les service environnementaux. Des comparaisons internationales de propritaires forestiers et de rsultats de gestion correspondants indiquent que les forts prives fournissent en proportion davantage de biens de march, comme le bois, et que leur performance environnementale, en termes de plans de gestion forestire, de certification forestire, et de respect des rgles forestires, semble tre similaire  celle des forts publiques. En ralit, les terres prives on fait crotre la conformit environnementale aux rgles, et ont adopt la certification forestire pour nombre des terres de haute production. Les terres prives et publiques devraient tablir des liens plus troits entre les droits de jouissance, la conservation et le contrle de la gestion. La proprit gouvernementale et des encouragements doivent apparatre pour les terres publiques et prives pour aider  fournir services et produits forestiers de manire plus efficace et quitable. En cuanto a la provisin de madera y de productos forestales no madereros y servicios ambientales, la tierra desempea una importancia fundamental, y la propiedad de la tierra es un factor clave que influye en la gestin y proteccin de tierras forestales. La mayor parte de los bosques mundiales, un 86%, es de propiedad estatal, que a su vez representa una proporcin similar de la degradacin forestal que ha ocurrido. En Estados Unidos, la mayora de las tierras forestales est en las manos de los propietarios privados, y por lo general esta situacin ha funcionado con xito en cuanto a la produccin y la provisin de servicios ambientales. Las comparaciones internacionales entre el rgimen de propiedad de la tierra y los resultados correspondientes en lo que se refiere a la gestin indican que, proporcionalmente, los bosques de propiedad privada producen una mayor cantidad de productos basados en el mercado (como madera, por ejemplo), y que su rendimiento ambiental en cuanto a los planes de gestin y certificacin forestal y al cumplimiento con los reglamentos forestales parece ser similar al de los bosques de propiedad estatal. De hecho, en las tierras de propiedad privada se ha aumentado el cumplimiento con reglamentos de carcter ambiental y se ha adoptado la certificacin forestal para muchas tierras de alto valor productivo. En las tierras estatales y privadas se debe igualmente esforzarse para lograr una relacin ms estrecha entre los derechos de tenencia y la conservacin y el control sobre la gestin forestal. En ambos casos, el rgimen de propiedad gubernamental y los incentivos proporcionados deben ser desarrollados para producir productos y servicios forestales de forma ms eficiente y equitativa.

43739793|Who benefits from community forestry - and who gets left out? Soon after it emerged as a significant trend in the global South in the 1980s, practitioners, advocates and scholars began to ask such questions of community forestry. The distributional impacts of its more recent development in industrialised countries have been less examined. More unusual still has been the explicit attempt to exchange experience between North and South. In response, a symposium was organised to bring together participants of two Ford Foundation-funded projects on community forestry in the US, Nepal, Kenya, and Tanzania. Enriched by additional cases from the United Kingdom and Asia, this introductory article and issue report on the symposium's results. These include the finding that, while community forestry can reduce social inequity, it generally does so by generating positive change at community and higher levels, rather than by delivering benefits directly to poor and marginalised households. Qui bnficie de la foresterie communautaire; et qui est laiss sur le bord du chemin? Les spcialistes, ceux qui la pratiquent et ceux qui la soutiennent, commencrent  poser de telles questions  la foresterie communautaire peu aprs son mergence en tant que courant notable dans le Sud global dans les annes 80. La distribution de ses impacts dans ses dveloppements plus rcents dans les pays industrialiss ont t moins examins. L'essai explicite d'change d'exprience entre le Nord et le Sud est vraiment peu habituel et a entran l'organisation d'un symposium pour permettre la rencontre des participants de deux projets de foresterie communautaire fonds par la Fondation Ford aux USA, au Npal, au Kenya et en Tanzanie. Cet article introductif qui comprend un rapport sur les rsultats du symposium est enrichi par des cas additionnels du Royaume-Uni et d'Asie. Ils incluent la dcouverte que, alors que la foresterie communautaire peut rduire l'ingalit sociale, elle l'obtient souvent en crant des changements aux niveaux communautaires, et aussi plus larges, plutt qu'en livrant les bnfices directement aux foyers dmunis et marginaliss. Quin se beneficia de la silvicultura comunitaria, y quin est excluido? Poco despus del surgimiento de la gestin forestal comunitaria en los pases del Sur en los aos 1980, los especialistas, defensores del modelo y profesionales del ramo empezaron a plantearse estas preguntas. Sin embargo, los impactos de la distribucin de su crecimiento ms reciente en pases industrializados no han sido sujetos a un examen tan riguroso, y ha habido muy pocos intentos explcitos de intercambiar las experiencias entre Norte y Sur. Con la incorporacin posterior de estudios adicionales del Reino Unido y de Asia, este artculo introductorio informa sobre las secuelas de este simposio. Entre otros resultados, se concluye que si la gestin forestal comunitaria es capaz de reducir la injusticia social, suele ser a travs de la generacin de cambios que benefician a escala comunitaria o a mayor escala an, y no mediante la creacin de beneficios directos para hogares pobres y marginalizados.
24309830|There are two main approaches to nature conservation in forest management. In the segregation approach, nature conservation is one of the management objectives which is limited to protected forest areas, while the integration approach considers the economic, social, and ecological components of sustainable forest management at the same time and place. Nature-based (close-to-nature) silviculture and forest planning that conserve natural stand dynamics, respect the local site conditions, monitor forest ecosystems and their conservation status, and harmonise suitable measures addressed to management objectives and nature conservation standards are crucial for integrating nature conservation into forest management. The social, economic, and bio-geographical conditions of forests vary greatly; therefore, concepts of integrating nature conservation into forest management cannot be uniform. On a global scale, the segregation model is generally accepted as the most suitable approach, but the integration model could be a possible alternative in many cases. Il existe deux approches principales pour la conservation de la nature dans la gestion forestire. Dans l'approche de sgrgation, la conservation de la nature est l'un des objectifs de la gestion limite aux zones forestires protges; alors que l'approche d'intgration considre les composs conomiques, sociaux et cologiques de la gestion forestire durable au mme moment, dans le mme espace. La sylviculture base sur la nature et le planning forestier conservant la dynamique naturelle des peuplements, respectant les conditions des sites locaux, surveillant les cosystmes forestiers et leur statut de conservation, et harmonisant des mesures appropries pour faire avancer les objectifs de gestion et les standards de conservation de la nature, sont cruciaux pour intgrer la conservation de la nature dans la gestion forestire. Les conditions sociales, conomiques et bio-gographiques des forts varient normment et les concepts d'intgration de la conservation de la nature dans la gestion forestire ne peuvent par consquent pas tre uniformes. Le modle de sgrgation est gnralement accept comme tant la meilleure approche, mais le modle d'intgration pourrait cependant tre une alternative possible dans de nombreux cas. En la gestin forestal existen dos enfoques principales para la proteccin de la naturaleza. En el modelo de la segregacin, la proteccin de la naturaleza es uno de los objetivos de gestin que se limita a reas forestales protegidas, mientras el modelo integrativo toma en cuenta los componentes econmicos, sociales y ecolgicos de la gestin forestal sostenible en el momento y el lugar en cuestin. Una silvicultura basada en la naturaleza y una planificacin de bosque que conserven la dinmica natural de las masas forestales, que respeten las condiciones especficas del lugar, que monitoreen los ecosistemas forestales y su estado de conservacin, y que establezcan medidas idneas para asegurar una armonizacin entre los objetivos de gestin y los estndares de proteccin de la naturaleza son fundamentales para la integracin de la proteccin de la naturaleza en la gestin forestal. Las condiciones sociales, econmicas y biogeogrficas de los bosques varan mucho, y por lo tanto los conceptos que tienen que ver con la integracin de la proteccin de la naturaleza en la gestin forestal tampoco pueden ser uniformes. A escala mundial, el modelo de la segregacin se acepta de forma general como el enfoque ms apropiado, pero el modelo de integracin podra servir de alternativa en muchos casos.

43739753|Indigenous Community Forest Operations (CFOs) that have been certified according to the Principles and Criteria of the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) face numerous obstacles in their struggle to remain certified and obtain tangible economic benefits. Three basic conditions for successful CFO certification are (i) socio-economic stability, (ii) economic viability, and (iii) community members demonstrating an understanding of the key concepts of the FSC certification process. Based upon fieldwork in four Bolivian CFOs and more than 140 interviews, this paper identifies some of the major constraints on community forestry certification in Bolivia. The findings suggest that the present conditions in the studied CFOs are jeopardizing FSC certification and its ability to yield a positive financial cost-benefit balance in the long term. In contrary to what is generally being assumed by Bolivian FSC experts and stakeholders, this study suggests that the recent tendency to form certified community-company alliances, as an alternative to existing approaches, might not (yet) be able to deliver much direct economic benefits to the communities. Las tecnologas para su conversin en sucedneos de gasolina y sobre todo de diesel son complejas y costosas. Sin embargo, el aprovechamiento y la aplicacin de estas tecnologas sern impulsados por el desafo doble del agotamiento de recursos petroleros y el calentamiento global. La gran disponibilidad de luz solar y las precipitaciones altas sugieren que el trpico puede ser la zona preferida para establecer plantaciones forestales dedicadas a la produccin de combustibles lignocelulsicos (o combustibles leosos, para distinguirlos de los combustibles de origen agrcola). Con precios para el petrleo entre 10 y 20% superiores a los niveles del 2007, los autores concluyen que la "opcin bioetanol" para plantaciones forestales tropicales en terrenos deforestados infrautilizados y sabanas hmedas es una posibilidad viable. En aras de poder satisfacer el aumento muy rpido de la demanda de biomasa que se espera, estos proyectos deben ser iniciados ahora. En este artculo se analizan los temas clave de los estudios de viabilidad relacionados.

42609390|The paper describes the outcome of the joint Indonesia/Federal Republic of Germany Social Forestry Development Project (SFDP) which has the overall goal of contributing to "increasing the welfare of the local population in forest areas while maintaining the sustainability of the forest resource base". The project focuses on timber harvesting as an activity to potentially supplement community livelihoods and has shown that commercial harvesting of the natural forest by local communities is possible and can be mutually beneficial to all concerned. The strengths and weaknesses of community-based harvesting of the natural forest are assessed. Its strengths lie in the simplicity of the system and its capability to be satisfactorily implemented by the target group. As such, the system itself would appear to be sufficiently robust to be adaptable to most situations, regardless of country, culture or tradition. Its weakness lies in the vulnerability of the system to those external factors that set the framework conditions in which the system is to be applied. The usefulness and replicability, both inside and outside of Indonesia, of the approach as a system that can provide opportunities to improve community livelihood and welfare largely depends on the support of the respective governments for community-based forest management, and their readiness to create compatible frameworks for their implementation. New investigation is required into how policy and institutional change can be made to improve governance at all levels, in order to motivate and support community based initiatives. 43739636|The paper examines the financial implications of both abandoned and destroyed wood by illegal pitsawers in Budongo Forest, Uganda. It also compares the intensity of pitsawing in the Strict Nature Reserve (SNR) and the forest edge as well as the species and diameter classes of trees most affected. The total wastage of round wood was found to be 0.218 m3/ha/yr and 0.098 m3/ha/yr in the SNR and forest edge respectively. This is about a third of the mean annual increment per hectare per year for tropical moist forests. The present value of monetary losses in the SNR and forest edge were UGX 30 000/ha/yr and UGX 17 814/ha/year respectively; with Mahogany species as the most affected. There was no significant loss of wood between the SNR and the forest edge and no significant diameter variations in the illegally pitsawn trees within and between the different pitsawing sites. More trees were pitsawn at the forest edge as compared to the SNR, although a larger volume of wood was harvested in the SNR. There is a need to enforce effective forest regulations governing SNRs; and foster a functional working relationship between the National Forestry Authority and local communities around the forest in the management of the SNR. 43740178|The forest management system of any country manifests the philosophy, principles and direction to be followed in the sustainable management of forest ecosystems. The management system of Turkey, essentially initiated in 1960's by the help of European counterparts, focuses primarily on commodity production. With 21 million ha of forested land, the country has several distinct biogeographic regions, each having its own endemic species and natural ecosystems providing major flyways for millions of migratory birds and containing almost three quarters of the total plant species in Europe. As such its management is of crucial importance to the rest of the world. Various forest values such as recreation, water production, soil protection and biodiversity conservation were, however, not integrated into forest management using advanced information technologies. Establishing an effective multiple use forest management system based on participation is a great challenge for the Turkish Forestry sector. This paper presents the current management philosophy, regulations, socio-cultural and organizational structure, and implementation of management activities across the country. The forest management system is criticized based on the sustainable forest management concept. Major pitfalls of the system are documented and some avenues for sound management are presented. The paper concludes that the management system is outdated with a neo-classic European style that focuses on a short-sighted solo area regulation with a single wood production focus and calls for an urgent change in the planning concept towards holistic management with the integration of various forest values based on ecosystem sustainability. 42609389|As in many countries, the state in South Africa assumed a major role in establishing forest plantations. South Africa's new forest policy, however, calls for radical changes in the way forests are managed to achieve national goals. A key element of this redefinition is the state's withdrawal from commercial forestry operations and the transfer of this function to the private sector. Sale of the land associated with these forests is, however, difficult given the requirements of the national land reform programme. In addition, concerns exist regarding the consequences of transferring full land title. A policy decision was therefore taken not to sell state forest land, but to offer use rights to it through the mechanism of a long-term lease. Leasing has consequently emerged as a central element in South Africa's plantation privatization process. Its anticipated success lies in a number of areas. These include: a belief that the transfer of ownership rights is not necessary for a resource to be well managed if use rights are sufficiently secure, and a recognition that incentives  specifically secure and tradable use  are more likely to achieve privatization objectives and sustainable management than regulations alone. While the success of the lease remains to be seen in practice, it already represents a fundamental shift in the state's perspectives of the private sector. A change which recognizes that state and private sector need not be at odds, if the instruments and incentives are put in place to ensure sound private sector management of forests for public and private interests. 42609212|A yield model for Cordia alliodora plantations in the Pacific lowlands of Ecuador is described.
